[{'created': '2018-01-22 14:48:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix monasca-forwarder never able to start

This issue is caused by a incompatible version of tornado framework in
stable/pike, because the ioloop.PeriodicCallback argument on init was
removed on a newer version of tornado.

commit_message:
Fix monasca-forwarder never able to start

This issue is caused by a incompatible version of tornado framework in
stable/pike, because the ioloop.PeriodicCallback argument on init was
removed on a newer version of tornado.

We just need to pin the version of tornado framework used by
the forwarder.

Task: 6211
Story: 2001489
Change-Id: Ic7cf0e11303b17582fa2fb1997539051c0519107

commit_message:
Containerize multinode-3nodes

This patch will force the 3nodes job to be containerized, like all jobs
should be in Queens.
Another patch in tripleo-quickstart will update the featureset.
Also moving Clustercheck service where MariaDB & Pacemaker run.
Also remove Heat since we'll run Tempest.

Change-Id: I31e1fe29491d2cbaa8ed9cd35ee84bbb1d455154
(cherry picked from commit fb9d83401c87813355c31e5205063a87a6f58377)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 16:21:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Ceilometer support

Our current Ceilometer driver relies on old version of ceilometer client,
which is in deprecated state and not compatible with the latest Telemetry
projects (Panko, Gnocchi). The functionality of the driver is not tested
automatically and most probably broken. So it's time to let it go and
clean the code.

This patch leaves "messaging" driver as default for notification and
makes "connection-string" a required parameter in CLI. In the future
we may consider to change default notification driver, though it
requires proper release note handling in all affected projects.

Change-Id: Id8442c4ff13c5cc33fd909b4757757cc5f396f50

Change-Id: Id8442c4ff13c5cc33fd909b4757757cc5f396f50

commit_message:
Remove Ceilometer support

Our current Ceilometer driver relies on old version of ceilometer client,
which is in deprecated state and not compatible with the latest Telemetry
projects (Panko, Gnocchi). The functionality of the driver is not tested
automatically and most probably broken. So it's time to let it go and
clean the code.

This patch leaves "messaging" driver as default for notification and
makes "connection-string" a required parameter in CLI. In the future
we may consider to change default notification driver, though it
requires proper release note handling in all affected projects.

Change-Id: Id8442c4ff13c5cc33fd909b4757757cc5f396f50

To a certain extent, this makes sense, but I hope that these problems can be solved in one go. Other documents also have this problem'}, {'account_id': 24739, 'date': '2018-01-17 09:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for you work.
But I think this patch is meaningless and unorder reponse codes don't affect the user's understanding.
We may put energy on more meaningful things."}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-01-18 01:17:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the patch :)

I noticed that there is a similar patch [1] about sorting the error codes, but the committer had abandoned it. IMHO, these changes make sense, but would you please take [2] as a reference to have these changes done together in one commit or would you please contact with the shangxiaobj <shangxiaobj@inspur.com> to work this out together? Simply adding Co-authored-by: shangxiaobj <shangxiaobj@inspur.com> in the commit message would count this patch for both of you two once it's merged. :)

Again, thanks for the contribution.

[1].https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534707/
[2].http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/api-ref/source/diagnostics.inc"}, {'account_id': 27366, 'date': '2018-01-23 08:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'account_id': 27572, 'date': '2018-01-23 07:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-23 07:32:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 25167, 'date': '2018-01-23 07:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This url is right.'}, {'account_id': 27572, 'date': '2018-01-23 08:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2017-12-01 20:01:10.000000000', 'message': "Rework Network client config for new SDK Connection

network.client.make_client() has always put a copy of it's SDK Connection
directly into ClientManager, the new-style Connection create will move
into osc-lib ClientManager, do it here too until then.

Change-Id: I1edfd19c9e73320768fb9640931fafe857c980b4
"}, {'created': '2018-01-22 22:51:38.000000000', 'message': "Rework Network client config for new SDK Connection

network.client.make_client() has always put a copy of it's SDK Connection
directly into ClientManager, the new-style Connection create will move
into osc-lib ClientManager, do it here too until then.

Change-Id: I1edfd19c9e73320768fb9640931fafe857c980b4
"}]
commit_message:
Rework Network client config for new SDK Connection

network.client.make_client() has always put a copy of it's SDK Connection
directly into ClientManager, the new-style Connection create will move
into osc-lib ClientManager, do it here too until then.

Change-Id: I1edfd19c9e73320768fb9640931fafe857c980b4

commit_message:
Enable multiattach capability for lvm driver

Multiattach was globally disabled for all in-tree drivers
in e499ab995de9c6dca353a115c6c68bd04594cdd9 but we'll need
to start enabling these to support the functionality.

A policy rule in the API, and/or an extra spec on the volume
type, should be used to distinguish which backends, or the
deployment in general, can support multiattach.

Related to blueprint multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: I158c6f20e3e6a24bd2e5299abbeb3fc5208e5885

commit_message:
Update the way to get docker version

Run "docker version" will get different in different of docker verion.
Get docker version by "docker info" is better.

Change-Id: I030697f276537ab81dd6c961e409b398bfac9bba
Close-Bug: #1743392

[{'created': '2018-01-09 11:31:26.000000000', 'message': 'Automatic host bootstrap is failed

If there are more than one storage driver for docker,restart docker
service will be failed.So we need define docker_storage_driver befo
re the docker restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1742114
'}]
commit_message:
Automatic host bootstrap is failed

If there are more than one storage driver for docker,restart docker
service will be failed.So we need define docker_storage_driver befo
re the docker restarted.

Change-Id: I3a05c191047ddccc127c33c167ff9cffa8cf9e9a
Closes-Bug: #1742114

commit_message:
Disable publishing of training-guides folder

The last content change to doc/training-guides was September 2016. We
still publish the content to /draft which is obsolete. Stop this
publishing for now.

Once training-guides gets updates, we can discuss publishing to a new
location.

Change-Id: I5086007cd76859e538929b1bda05babab9bc7ec6

[{'created': '2018-01-04 05:50:48.000000000', 'message': 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers failed because of docker restart failed

The version of docker installed by script is latest edge >=
1.13.0. ExecStart command need update.The "docker daemon" is moved to
"dockerd".

Closes-Bug:#1724069
'}]
commit_message:
kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers failed because of docker restart failed

The version of docker installed by script is latest edge >=
1.13.0. ExecStart command need update.The "docker daemon" is moved to
"dockerd".

Change-Id: Ib0e74b77fbd38954cfd4eaffe2c44b3ba16756e8
Closes-Bug:#1724069

commit_message:
add some info about kolla tool install

If you want to use kolla-build to build image, you should install kolla by pip first.

Change-Id: I2b5770c0fd068bb0ca249f62ce1a92dd47d1bbd8
Closes-Bug:#1732062

This change makes sense to me.  I'm not sure why we have the unit and functional tests mixed in (only thing I can think of is it makes sure both are run in the gate, but we can take care of that simply by running them both in the gate).  Also, I think the un-compressed environment definitions Sean uses are much easier to read than what we have now."}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-01-23 00:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Makes sense for couple of reasons;

commit_message:
Separate out functional tests

This breaks out the functional tests from the unit tests to allow running
just unit test for faster validation. Additional gate jobs will be added
to run the new functional test jobs so we don't lose that coverage, but
during development, by default only the unit tests will run.

Change-Id: I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761

commit_message:
Add zun configuration about oslo.concurrency

Zun use oslo.concurrency to achieve safely running multi-thread,
multi-process applications. The lock_path is directory to use for
lock files. If external locks are used, lock path must be set.

Change-Id: I4f667d9699ec2231722bcfd7c5f84ba47fc8465c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 08:55:55.000000000', 'message': "Added session.flush() before update_on_match()

* It turns out that update_on_match() from oslo_db breaks fields
  of a persistent object (attached to the session) in some cases.
  For example, when we use PostgreSQL as a DB it doesn't properly
  merge fields of the given specimen onto the fields of the object
  attached to the SQLAlchemy session. For some reason, it cleans up
  the history of ORM events registered before this operation so
  that if some update took place in this session and they are not
  flushed yet to DB they simply get lost. Hence adding flush()
  on the session right before this operation helps.
* NOTE: this is rather a workaround than a fix of the root cause.
  Root cause still needs to be found.

Change-Id: I546badd8b1c96b68567287fc9d38b07738272503
Closes-Bug: #1736821
"}, {'created': '2018-01-22 09:17:07.000000000', 'message': "Added session.flush() before update_on_match()

commit_message:
Added session.flush() before update_on_match()

* It turns out that update_on_match() from oslo_db breaks fields
  of a persistent object (attached to the session) in some cases.
  For example, when we use PostgreSQL as a DB it doesn't properly
  merge fields of the given specimen onto the fields of the object
  attached to the SQLAlchemy session. For some reason, it cleans up
  the history of ORM events registered before this operation so
  that if some update took place in this session and they are not
  flushed yet to DB they simply get lost. Hence adding flush()
  on the session right before this operation helps.
* NOTE: this is rather a workaround than a fix of the root cause.
  Root cause still needs to be found.

Change-Id: I546badd8b1c96b68567287fc9d38b07738272503
Closes-Bug: #1736821

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468632/12/docker/mariadb/extend_start.sh'}, {'account_id': 22997, 'date': '2017-12-25 06:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

But for cluster, I have test it works on Debian9 mariadb 10.1.26 aarcha64  with bellow patch and this patch[3]. 

kolla-ansible/ansible/roles/mariadb/templates/galera.cnf.j2
@@ -33,10 +33,11 @@ wsrep_sst_receive_address={{ api_interface_address }}:{{ mariadb_sst_port }}
 wsrep_provider={{ wsrep_driver }}
 wsrep_cluster_name="{{ database_cluster_name }}"
 wsrep_node_name={{ ansible_hostname }}
-wsrep_sst_method=xtrabackup-v2
+wsrep_sst_method=mariabackup
 wsrep_sst_auth={{ database_user }}:{{ database_password }}
 wsrep_slave_threads=4
 wsrep_notify_cmd=/usr/local/bin/wsrep-notify.sh
+wsrep_on=ON

After using RDO mariadb, i found galera is fallback from galera-25.3.20
to 25.3.16. 

I am not sure what's the exact difference between these two version. But
what i found is:

> ‘SAFE TO BOOTSTRAP’ PROTECTION [1]
> Starting with provider version 3.19, Galera has an additional protection
> against attempting to boostrap the cluster using a node that may not
> have been the last node remaining in the cluster prior to cluster shutdown.

So the question is: it is safe to fallback galera version?


[1] http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/restartingcluster.html#safe-to-bootstrap-protection"}, {'account_id': 22997, 'date': '2018-01-15 10:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

commit_message:
Consume RDO packaged mariadb version

RDO packaged mariadb recieves far more testing and qualification
than any other mariadb package on CentOS.  Lets use that instead
of a hard-pinned old version of mariadb from mariadb.org.

This patch also upgrade MariaDB from 10.0 to 10.1.20 for
RHEL/CentOS/Oracle Linux.

Depends-On: I8374ac2219ad7880970cd789727d01af7cac1077
Depends-On: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Co-Authored-By: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>
Change-Id: I071362fc1b8d60199a77e2fe0475d2b4c3b5341b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-10 09:00:47.000000000', 'message': '[RFE] Support regex matching when filtering port with IP address

Problem
=======
The GET /ports API only support exact matching when filtering by IP
address.
Providing support for more powerful regex matching filtering could be very
useful.

Usecase
=======
Nova allows filtering instance by IP address and it is in regex matching
manner, but it now has serious performance issue [1]. How to enhance the
performance of this filter has been discussed in Queens PTG [2]. When
filtering instance by IP addresses, first calling Neutron port list API
with IP address filtering, and then retrieve the instance UUID in Nova
side could be a possible solution to improve the performance.

As Nova allows regex manner filtering, it could be better to make Neutron
also support regex matching.

Proposal
========
Adding regex matching support in DB layer using "LIKE" SQL phrase.

References
==========
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1711303
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122258.html

Change-Id: Ibac712ce2aa73386142207e34baba329c15ed4b8
'}, {'created': '2017-11-10 09:08:01.000000000', 'message': '[RFE] Support regex matching when filtering port with IP address

address.
Providing support for more powerful regex matching filtering could be very

manner, but it now has serious performance issue [1]. How to enhance the
performance of this filter has been discussed in Queens PTG [2]. When
filtering instance by IP addresses, first calling Neutron port list API
with IP address filtering, and then retrieve the instance UUID in Nova
side could be a possible solution to improve the performance.

As Nova allows regex manner filtering, it could be better to make Neutron
also support regex matching.

Proposal
========

References
==========
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1711303
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122258.html

Change-Id: Ibac712ce2aa73386142207e34baba329c15ed4b8

commit_message:
Support substring pattern  matching when filtering port with IP address

This spec aimed to add a new API extension for
``port`` resource to show whether or not the
substring pattern  matching capability is available.

Extend existing GET ``/ports`` API to allow
substring pattern matching when filtering by IP
address. Also Extend related models in DB layer to
support LIKE SQL query.

Related-Bug: 1718605

Change-Id: Ibac712ce2aa73386142207e34baba329c15ed4b8

(1 comment)

Minor comment. 

I think you should add this file to your main change in vitrage, or else add in the commit message Depends-On your main change. We can't approve the release notes before approving the code :-)"}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-01-04 17:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-nova-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/01/456601/3/check/gate-nova-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/e04b5fe//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 38s
- gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/01/456601/3/check/gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/7d9180a/ : SUCCESS in 2m 42s
- gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/01/456601/3/check/gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/3358101/ : SUCCESS in 2m 51s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-04-28 08:27:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'm pretty sure this is not needed. IVSHMEM has been removed from upstream OVS/DPDK [1] and all that's needed for vhost-user interfaces is to add hugepages to the instance. Am I missing something else?

[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/90ca71dd317fea1ccf0040389dae895aa7b2b561"}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2017-05-09 19:19:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Currently, IVSHMEM support is deprecated from but still required for real-time usecases which OVS/DPDK doesn't cover completely. It is likely that users use an old version of DPDK with OpenStack for high performance. Do you think that OpenStack should consider only the latest version of DPDK? Thanks."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-05-16 15:18:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Currently, IVSHMEM support is deprecated from but still required
 > for real-time usecases which OVS/DPDK doesn't cover completely. It
 > is likely that users use an old version of DPDK with OpenStack for
 > high performance. Do you think that OpenStack should consider only
 > the latest version of DPDK? Thanks.

Yes, I do. I can't see how it would be wise to add support for a technology that's already been deprecated. This feature was rejected by both the DPDK and QEMU communities, and it should be rejected here also"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-07-26 03:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Yes, I do. I can't see how it would be wise to add support for a
 > technology that's already been deprecated. 

Thank you for the reply. IVSHMEM feature is no longer supported on DPDK. But how would you say if it is supported out of DPDK? We are now developing SPP, a DPDK-based vswitch, and planning to implement ivshmem support under our SPP code tree if nova (and libvirt) are acceptable for ivshmem configuration."}, {'account_id': 26576, 'date': '2017-09-19 01:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-09-19 10:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

The libvirt-options-for-dpdk.rst will be added in specs/pike/approved.
But it sohuld be proposed for Rocky release.
So the libvirt-options-for-dpdk.rst should be in specs/rocky/approved/ directory.
And use the template for Rocky release (specs/rocky-template.rst).'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:33:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Thank you for comments!'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2017-11-29 03:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-08 16:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-18 13:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-01-19 16:40:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Approving this for now. I'd love to see some English-language documentation links for these ARM-specific CPU instruction set extensions (or CPU features?) instead of links to the kernel patch that added a particular hwcaps enum value. See the hw/cpu/x86.py module for examples of documentation links I'm looking for.

That said, I won't hold this up for that. Feel free to add a patch in the future with those doc links.

Thanks,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:25:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Approving this for now. I'd love to see some English-language
 > documentation links for these ARM-specific CPU instruction set
 > extensions (or CPU features?) instead of links to the kernel patch
 > that added a particular hwcaps enum value. See the hw/cpu/x86.py
 > module for examples of documentation links I'm looking for.
 > 
 > That said, I won't hold this up for that. Feel free to add a patch
 > in the future with those doc links.
 > 
 > Thanks,
 > 
 > -jay

@Jay,
Thanks a lot for your approval.
I will modify the patch after the document is ready."}]

commit_message:
Don't fstrim vfat partitions

This small change avoids running fstrim on vfat partitions.

The mount order test-case has been updated to also test the mkfs
creation components, and the input config modified to have a vfat
partition to cover this path.

Change-Id: I8952e748d4bdc12a5769706de9057c1e97d95e37

commit_message:
Remove deprecated 'orchestration' config group options

'orchestration' config group options were deprecated in
Id0f69f3b60cbb4f4a1f1fa7e18c7700490d6656a

And heat tests also been removed from tempest
- Ifc2cac575919da4e361eaa3234d7e0f3e2f98d21

Now we can remove these deprecated config options.

Cleaning up heat related things in account_generator,
cleanup_service etc.

Change-Id: I1c02fd88c3d93b511ff4a6b54b668ebd306481a9

subject: Execut dhclient command when IPA start
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25675, 'date': '2017-12-21 10:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25675, 'date': '2017-12-21 10:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25675, 'date': '2017-12-21 12:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

The community is currently undecided on this bug. From my point of view, we have no way of knowing if just running dhclient would solve every case. Being that those cases are environment dependent, the ramdisk not getting a DHCP address on it's own is... an issue with the ramdisk and not IPA.

Shifting that burden to IPA, means that we are adding functionality, and as such this really should be treated as an RFE if the community decides that this is worth integrating into IPA, as we need to solve for multiple distributions and networking architectures. As a result, I'm marking this patch with -2 until there is a decision with regard to the bug and scope."}, {'account_id': 25675, 'date': '2018-01-23 05:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Execut dhclient command when IPA start

Due to some unknown reason deploy image does not get IP address when
start. This will result deploy failed. In case execut dhclient
command when IPA start.

Partial-bug: #1739576

Change-Id: Icbb806d1436f746a0696deac42f005cacbcf24d9

commit_message:
Catch exception in volume get

Server return 500 when creating a container with non-existing volume
uuid in current version. We should add exception handler in volume get.

Change-Id: I5920a3a51b7c8d78f516b947045235ddd78e729c
Closes-Bug: #1742346

subject: Let keystoneauth handle version discovery
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-18 18:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-18 22:09:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This looks cool. A problem: this doesn't quite work yet. I put the unversioned endpoint in my catalog but version discovery fails because authentication is required even for the simple GET / needed to look at available versions. I'm assuming we should fix that in Sahara itself..."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-18 22:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-19 15:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Yes! Please remove auth requirement from the version discovery documents. We're working on adding guidance about that here:
  
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459710/17/guidelines/discoverability.rst

In the "Unversioned Discovery" section.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-19 16:33:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I've only just glanced at the document you've linked (plus checked to see what a few other services are doing)... is it just GET / which needs to work without auth, or also GET /vX ?"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-01-19 17:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-01-19 17:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

fixing pep8 error'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-20 03:29:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So I have a patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536002/ which drops the auth requirement for version discovery.

But, things still don't work right -- we don't get our project id added back into the URL so trying to do v1.1 stuff fails with 404"}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For those out of the loop, my concerns from the previous comment have been resolved'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This doesn't really have to be separate patch -- otherwise that means the existing patch has to contain "bad code". That feels wrong to me -- so I'll put these changes in the other patch and add Monty as coauthor.'}]

commit_message:
Let keystoneauth handle version discovery

keystoneauth can take care of doing all the version discovery correctly.
Just let it do its thing.

Change-Id: I0f778e32834e64d681d07131ef46ffea3a8d5b02

commit_message:
Validate metadata before reserve quota

Snapshot's quota reservations are left when
failed to validate metadata. Place the check
statement right before quota reserve.

Change-Id: Iae3ce945f51ae7fac76a997063b238bf59d62939
Closes-Bug: #1742371

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for Nova placement API

This patch adds script for docker health check of Nova placement API service.
The script checks API service using curl.

Change-Id: I31ab3f6777acddc802a321ff9a4728ebf574c0d4

commit_message:
Move token_formatter to token

This change moves the token_formatter under fernet to be located
under the token directory. This is to allow for the functionality
of token_formatter to be easily used with other token providers.

Change-Id: I3a1ee30f69c33c9dd98c7e39e552b7908cc836e1

commit_message:
Remove redundant swap_volume tests

Change I36b2e2ae introduced several unit tests designed to test a fix
for a bug in swap_volume caused by BDM mangling. Change If74dd9d8
subsequently removed the BDM mangling, which made the tests
irrelevant. It also removed the only user of the source_type argument
to _test_swap_volume_driver, which was the only differentiator between
the tests, meaning the tests were all identical.

Change-Id: I851a565c06ef2dc3d3d4a530aeb7f89e58f00046

Log radvd config contents on reload when debug is on

This may help to understand whether L3 agent correctly configured the
daemon.

[{'created': '2018-01-22 20:02:23.000000000', 'message': "Correct indendation of docker_puppet_apply.sh run

The backport of Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca had an
indentation error which caused the command to be
['/docker_puppet_apply.sh'] instead of '/docker_puppet_apply.sh'

This caused an error when paunch logged the command it would run.

Making the paunch logging more robust would have made this easier to
debug, as would capturing /var/log/tripleo-config in our CI jobs.

Change-Id: I80734ccc842d5be01555ee5a863d0de9a8101d33
Closes-Bug: #1743754

commit_message:
Correct indentation of docker_puppet_apply.sh run

The backport of Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca had an
indentation error which caused the command to be
['/docker_puppet_apply.sh'] instead of '/docker_puppet_apply.sh'

This caused an error when paunch logged the command it would run.

Making the paunch logging more robust would have made this easier to
debug, as would capturing /var/log/tripleo-config in our CI jobs.

Change-Id: I80734ccc842d5be01555ee5a863d0de9a8101d33
Closes-Bug: #1743754

  enable_service q-trunk

extension show trunk) the panel should automatically appear under
Project/Network/Trunks.

commit_message:
Trunks panel: enable project trunk panel by default

The trunk panel in the project dashboard is completed,
so this commit enables it by default.

To test it build devstack with neutron trunk support. Eg:

  local.conf:
  enable_plugin neutron https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron
  enable_service q-trunk

As long as the 'trunk' API extension is available (openstack
extension show trunk) the panel should automatically appear under
Project/Network/Trunks.

Change-Id: I5f5e343f21ac92e4195825e44f0f3d58b44c134a
Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui

subject: Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 03:02:25.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)

Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'

Replace 'assertTrue(a in b)' with 'assertIn(a, b)'

[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality. Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertEqual(...) is preferred over assertTrue(... == ...), and
assertNotEqual(...) is preferred over assertFalse(... == ...).
Off by default.

Change-Id: Icd8522ed1b54083d7413c158a848351986e59ad9
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)

Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'

Replace 'assertTrue(a in b)' with 'assertIn(a, b)'

[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality. Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertEqual(...) is preferred over assertTrue(... == ...), and
assertNotEqual(...) is preferred over assertFalse(... == ...).
Off by default.

Change-Id: Icd8522ed1b54083d7413c158a848351986e59ad9

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated 'message' attribute in Exception

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated and removed
from Python3.
For more details, please check:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

P.S.
The 'message' attribute still exists in the below file.

masakari/api/validation/validators.py

Because jsonschema.ValidationError has 'message' attribute:
http://python-jsonschema.readthedocs.io/en/latest/errors/#jsonschema.exceptions.ValidationError.message

Change-Id: Id83f15b6d7c7cd4811f2b2e2e56db607a0e19f4d

commit_message:
move to 'sgdisk' for GPT

'sgdisk' is native GPT tool (compared to parted)

This change allow us to control partition type and name.

Size calculations can be skipped as 'sgdisk' allow us to create
partitions one after another with just giving requested size.

Depends-on: I6b819a8071389e7e4eb4874ff7750bd192695ff2

DSCP marking rules are done by L2 agent as OpenFlow or iptables
rule.

Change-Id: If45b20ea1d673eabd7713e461aa26a3618476967

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Clean DSCP mark rule when port removed

DSCP marking rules are done by L2 agent as OpenFlow or iptables
rule.
This is new fullstack test to check if L2 agent don't left such
orphaned rules after delete of instance.

Change-Id: If45b20ea1d673eabd7713e461aa26a3618476967

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Ensure cleanup is performed correctly on roles

When using existing users (for e.g. LDAP setup) rally when specified
roles context it tends to assign and remove roles, which can be problematic
if the roles are already assigned to the users. This fix checks whether the
user already a member of the role, if so it doesn't attempt to cleanup

Closes-Bug: #1720270

Change-Id: I8638eb0e59fdea2fdbbdf87728da70530fd22e14

subject: Add timestamp for queue (mongo)
messages: [{'account_id': 14203, 'date': '2018-01-21 17:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-01-23 01:57:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nPlease propose a spec or at least a bug to track this change. It's not trivial change since it's changing the data model. Thanks."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-21 17:02:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add timestamp for queue (mongo)

Queue creation time and update time is a more important attribute.
So, this patch is to add these new attributes to the queue schema.

commit_message:
Add timestamp for queue (mongo)

Queue creation time and update time is a more important attribute.
So, this patch is to add these new attributes to the queue schema.

Change-Id: I85e718e306192f66797554f3c72aed918bfc6ca5

commit_message:
Migrate tox-self test

Import tox-self test as Zuul v3 native job.

Use tox as parent, we do not need the global upper-constraints.txt
file checked out.

Also, remove name from project stanza, this is now unneeded.

Change-Id: I1ca07da79e02158903ceccb03093d9408ebfd685
Needed-By: I3c9459d5982ff4a56da8c111cce11730d107927c

commit_message:
H802 hacking have been deprecated

H802 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of fuel-web require hacking=0.10.
So remove H802 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1653923

Change-Id: I63c5de308c6b923431f0345ed2dbfea411571bd1

commit_message:
Redis connection support password configure in zaqar

Redis connection doesn't support password configure in zaqar,
so redis-server can not set a password. If redis service doesn't
set a password, it will suffer a large number of attacks.
The patch will support password configure in zaqar. In addition,
it is needed to add unit test in the previous
patch[https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511676/].

Change-Id: I03661584f1c24fdb3e76a819c9eaa0ed32f272c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 02:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'Always kill all child processes when backup runner exits.

In stream_backup_to_storage, uploading to backup end may failed with
an exception, then backup runner context will exits and reraise the
exception, but child proccesses will be left running. When
innobackupex is used for MySQL backup, this may cause the whole
MySQL service being locked. So child processes should always be killed
when the context exits.

Change-Id: I843bca7186cdc6b40fd241798792e42a0fd04eb0
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Always kill all child processes when backup runner exits.

In stream_backup_to_storage, uploading to backup end may failed with
an exception, then backup runner context will exits and reraise the
exception, but child proccesses will be left running. When
innobackupex is used for MySQL backup, this may cause the whole
MySQL service being locked. So child processes should always be killed
when the context exits.

Change-Id: I843bca7186cdc6b40fd241798792e42a0fd04eb0
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Adapt workload_stabilization strategy to new datasource backend

This patch set:
1. Removes nova, ceilometer and gnocchi properties.
2. Adds using of datasource_backend properties along with
   statistic_aggregation method.
3. Changes type of datasource config.

Change-Id: I4a2f05772248fddd97a41e27be4094eb59ee0bdb
Partially-Implements: blueprint watcher-multi-datasource

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I6e3389b066f9f4c0eddd8baa7b70e6602342fded

commit_message:
Fix glance-storage-init job fail when upgrade

This patch changes "kubectl create" command to "kubectl apply"
When upgrade glance chart, glance-storage-init job fails because
"kubectl create secret ..." command returns already exists error.

Change-Id: I95944b1bb6df8558be6e6a6740d9f2aff50a9a9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 18:49:25.000000000', 'message': "Remove oslo config global conf dependency

Ceilometer in Ocata made several changes to
move away from  oslo config's global conf.
Instead ceilometer/service.py now creates a
oslo config object that gets passed to the
publisher.

To keep up with the changes had to make
the following changes in monasca-ceilometer
1.) Monasca Publisher now extends
ConfigPublisherBase, with conf as argument
2.) monasca_client now takes conf as an
argument during intialization.
3.) Added monasca_ceilometer_opts to
intialize all ConfigOpts. This will have
to be regiested in ceilometer/opts.py.
(will need a additional line in opts.py)
4.) Introduced three new properties
service_username, service_password and
service_auth_url since username, password
and auth_url were removed from
[service_credentials] section.
5.) Added api/health.py, service.py
and opts.py from ceilometer code base
which were modified to read
monasca ceilometer options via
monasca_ceilometer_opts.py
6.) Added ostestr to test requirements
and updated tox.ini to run tests in
serial (to avoid problems with
singleton mapping classes, stepping
on each other test values  when
run in parallel)

List of Ceilometer changes to remove
global conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384834
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384624
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386025

This change also modifies test-requirements.txt
to bring this master branch up to the stable/pike
version of ceilometer, and python-monascaclient
up to 1.7.1 (pike).

Change-Id: Ieb7962a50fdb5d12ea6238c96ed116e8b2c83c48
"}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo config global conf dependency

Ceilometer in Ocata made several changes to
move away from  oslo config's global conf.
Instead ceilometer/service.py now creates a
oslo config object that gets passed to the
publisher.

To keep up with the changes had to make
the following changes in monasca-ceilometer
1.) Monasca Publisher now extends
ConfigPublisherBase, with conf as argument
2.) monasca_client now takes conf as an
argument during intialization.
3.) Added monasca_ceilometer_opts to
intialize all ConfigOpts. This will have
to be regiested in ceilometer/opts.py.
(will need a additional line in opts.py)
4.) Introduced three new properties
service_username, service_password and
service_auth_url since username, password
and auth_url were removed from
[service_credentials] section.
5.) Added api/health.py, service.py
and opts.py from ceilometer code base
which were modified to read
monasca ceilometer options via
monasca_ceilometer_opts.py
6.) Added ostestr to test requirements
and updated tox.ini to run tests in
serial (to avoid problems with
singleton mapping classes, stepping
on each other test values  when
run in parallel)

List of Ceilometer changes to remove
global conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384834
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384624
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386025

This change also modifies test-requirements.txt
to bring this master branch up to the stable/pike
version of ceilometer, and python-monascaclient
up to 1.7.1 (pike).

Change-Id: Ieb7962a50fdb5d12ea6238c96ed116e8b2c83c48

commit_message:
Reducing tempest_workers to 1 for fs016

Usually, the concurrency is set to number of cpus / 2, however we are
seeing parallelism issues with this particular featureset when tests are
running in in parallel. So, let's test running the jobs without
parallelism for now.

Change-Id: I78c8b0b47595eea5d8fd417548e1f5bfeecd0889
Related-Bug: #1742936

commit_message:
Reducing tempest_workers to 1 for fs017

Usually, the concurrency is set to number of cpus / 2, however we are
seeing parallelism issues with this particular featureset when tests are
running in in parallel. So, let's test running the jobs without
parallelism for now.

Change-Id: Ic232f2395971bdef9d0ac48e0d7f9007919eac5c
Related-Bug: #1744151

[{'created': '2018-01-19 16:42:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix trunk with subport functional tests

The patch febeaf5d4016157d0cca41023e64b91e550453e8 in Neutron broke the
way we were using to verify if the subport was bound in our functional tests.

This patch takes a different approach to verify it.

Change-Id: I9f9096d9248bab4d222e63f2d7d83b8e0b37f9d1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix trunk with subport functional tests

The patch febeaf5d4016157d0cca41023e64b91e550453e8 in Neutron broke the
way we were using to verify if the subport was bound in our functional tests.

This patch takes a different approach to verify it.

Change-Id: I9f9096d9248bab4d222e63f2d7d83b8e0b37f9d1

Add XClarity Driver

This patch proposes to add new interfaces for management and power
for the Lenovo XClarity Driver.

Change-Id: Ic2743f9a4959a6165a7ec40f4772afb231205f36
Closes-Bug: #1702508

commit_message:
Fix releasenotes builds

The shade/occ merge brought over stable branch releasenotes files that
openstacksdk doesn't have. Remove them.

Change-Id: I716ee9cb4146d39daee48f29480fc8fbd89bed4e

commit_message:
Remove get_legacy_client

We don't have any interest in having the SDK provide a mechanism for
people to get python-*client objects. Remove the method.

Change-Id: I10169ae61bee48e262b70c5ba3aa0885e4ad188c

commit_message:
[DNM] testing nodepool forcing to py3 in devstack job

Current nodepool job failures seem to be related to running under
py2 with the new nodepool branch; see if this fixes them up

Change-Id: Ib164be006f9199d1752e6c76ddb23bcecdd4ac30
Depends-On: Id01f470e2d3424c3789a8f05f9eb05ac783f8363

commit_message:
Collect /var/lib/tripleo-config/.

Collecting these logs might be useful for debugging a container
initialization issues we are facing where paunch fails with "sequence
item 33: expected string, list found", it's hard to see what triggered
the issue, being able to look at the step config fed into paunch could
help.

This is how the dir looks on my current deployment:

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# du -h /var/lib/tripleo-config/
176K /var/lib/tripleo-config/

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# ls -1 /var/lib/tripleo-config/
docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
puppet_step_config.pp

Change-Id: I93fce883c6f4c2c6f842bc92c7c45e028f73f4cf

commit_message:
Move user guide from horizon to LBaaS dashboard

User guide on LBaaS v2 dashboard was imported
into horizon during the doc-migration effort in Pike.
This commit moves the content from horizon to
neutron-lbaas-dashboard repository.

Change-Id: I44d9c00796cb69f93b216952e87f23c262b18347
Closes-Bug: #1741615

- gate-zaqar-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/33/345133/15/check/gate-zaqar-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/0745a2d/ : SUCCESS in 2m 25s'}, {'account_id': 22484, 'date': '2017-09-19 02:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

After removing the poolgroup, I have some questions about the api design, I think out two designs. Are there better designs?

1.design 1: 
step1: 
(First specify capabilities, only the storage back-end pools can use the flavor with the capabilities.
It is similar to the relationship of flavor and instances in nova.)

openstack messaging flavor create flavor1  --capabilities '["FIFO", "CLAIMS", "DURABILITY", "AOD", "HIGH_THROUGHPUT"]'
openstack messaging flavor create flavor2  --capabilities '["FIFO", "CLAIMS", "AOD", "HIGH_THROUGHPUT"]'

step2:
openstack pool create pool11 mongodb://dbserver1:27017  50 --flavor flavor1
openstack pool create pool12 mongodb://dbserver2:27017  50 --flavor flavor1

openstack pool create pool21 redis://dbserver3:6379  50 --flavor flavor2
openstack pool create pool22 redis://dbserver4:6379  50 --flavor flavor2
step3:
openstack queue create queue11 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue11   '{"_flavor": "flavor1"}'
openstack queue create queue12 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue12   '{"_flavor": "flavor1"}'

openstack queue create queue21 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue21   '{"_flavor": "flavor2"}'
openstack queue create queue22 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue22   '{"_flavor": "flavor2"}'

note:
The command [flavor create]: the parameter [--capabilities] is valid, even if set in cli, the server is not used, this need to modify?

2.design 2:
step1:
(If flavor1 doesn't exist, we can create flavor1 and add to the flavor table):
openstack pool create pool11 mongodb://dbserver1:27017  50 --flavor flavor1    
 (we check: only the storage back-end pools can use the flavor1 with the capabilities)
openstack pool create pool12 mongodb://dbserver2:27017  50 --flavor flavor1


(If flavor2 doesn't exist, we can create flavor2 and add to the flavor table):
openstack pool create pool21 redis://dbserver3:6379  50 --flavor flavor2
(we check: only the storage back-end pools can use the flavor1 with the capabilities)
openstack pool create pool22 redis://dbserver4:6379  50 --flavor flavor2


step2:
openstack queue create queue11 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue11   '{"_flavor": "flavor1"}'
openstack queue create queue12 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue12   '{"_flavor": "flavor1"}'

openstack queue create queue21 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue21   '{"_flavor": "flavor2"}'
openstack queue create queue22 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue22   '{"_flavor": "flavor2"}'

note:
The flavor table only is used to view capabilities.'}, {'account_id': 22484, 'date': '2017-09-19 02:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

3.design 3:
step1:

openstack pool create pool11 mongodb://dbserver1:27017  50     
openstack pool create pool12 mongodb://dbserver2:27017  50 


openstack pool create pool21 redis://dbserver3:6379  50 
openstack pool create pool22 redis://dbserver4:6379  50 

step2:
openstack messaging flavor create flavor1    --pool '["poo11", "pool12"]'
openstack messaging flavor create flavor1    --pool '["poo21", "pool22"]'

step3:
openstack queue create queue11 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue11   '{"_flavor": "flavor1"}'
openstack queue create queue12 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue12   '{"_flavor": "flavor1"}'

openstack queue create queue21 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue21   '{"_flavor": "flavor2"}'
openstack queue create queue22 
openstack messaging queue set metadata queue22   '{"_flavor": "flavor2"}''}, {'account_id': 8846, 'date': '2017-09-19 03:08:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

@gengchc2 I'd like the design 3,  it will make the api and behavior changes minimum.  Users only need to instead pools to pool_group.  And will set the relationship of flavor and pools in one API request."}, {'account_id': 22484, 'date': '2017-09-19 05:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

@wanghao: Can you add the detailed changes of api into this spec?'}, {'account_id': 8846, 'date': '2017-09-25 06:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

commit_message:
Remove pool group from pool and flavor resource

Currently pool group is used in pool and flavor resource,
but the pool group only supports a 1:1 mapping with flavor.
So it's not necessary to keep it since we can map
1 flavor : N pool directly.

For making a clarification to end user,
this bp proposes to remove useless pool group from Zaqar,
just keeps the pool resource.

Change-Id: I5927aea4e1ffa632bb78e3fa9d340c3d812bad2a
Implements: blueprint remove-pool-group-from-zaqar

commit_message:
object count of no shard ranges should be zero not None

If there are no active shard ranges then the shard usage
should report zero object_count and bytes_used, not None.

Change-Id: Iac213cf597d97334920035ca3c83d5e34c0985c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 12:06:01.000000000', 'message': 'Rename application credential restriction column

In the application credential spec[1] we decided to add on a parameter
that would control whether an application credential could be used to
create other application credentials. This parameter is also used to
control whether it can be used to delete other application credentials
and whether it can create and delete trusts. Therefore the name
`allow_application_credential_creation` is misleading. Moreover, giving
a property of the resource a name that is an imperative verb is not
great. It makes more sense for a property to be a noun, an adjective, or
a passive verb.

This change renames the `allow_application_credential_creation`` column
to ``unrestricted``. This maintains the same boolean context, i.e. a
"true" value for the old name maintains the same meaning as a "true"
value for the new name.

At this point, the application credential API has not yet been exposed,
so there should be no data in this table and no need for complicated
migration triggers. In general, we only need to do a column alter to
rename it. Sqlite is special because it does not support column alters,
so in order to accomodate our tests the migration involves copying the
whole table, minus the old column, and recreating it with the new
column.

Change-Id: Id26a2790acae25f80bd28a8cb121c80cb5064645

so in order to accomodate our tests the migration involves copying the

Change-Id: Id26a2790acae25f80bd28a8cb121c80cb5064645
'}]
commit_message:
Rename application credential restriction column

In the application credential spec[1] we decided to add on a parameter
that would control whether an application credential could be used to
create other application credentials. This parameter is also used to
control whether it can be used to delete other application credentials
and whether it can create and delete trusts. Therefore the name
`allow_application_credential_creation` is misleading. Moreover, giving
a property of the resource a name that is an imperative verb is not
great. It makes more sense for a property to be a noun, an adjective, or
a passive verb.

This change renames the `allow_application_credential_creation`` column
to ``unrestricted``. This maintains the same boolean context, i.e. a
"true" value for the old name maintains the same meaning as a "true"
value for the new name.

At this point, the application credential API has not yet been exposed,
so there should be no data in this table and no need for complicated
migration triggers. In general, we only need to do a column alter to
rename it. Sqlite is special because it does not support column alters,
so in order to accomodate our tests the migration involves copying the
whole table, minus the old column, and recreating it with the new
column.

Change-Id: Id26a2790acae25f80bd28a8cb121c80cb5064645

commit_message:
Add system column to app cred table

While the application credential logic was going through review we
noticed the project_id column of the table was not nullable. It is
possible for this to hinder the ability to create system-level
application credentials in the future.

For now, let's create a system column for application credentials
and alter the table so that project_ids can be nullable. This will
make it easier to expand application credential usage in the future.

bp application-credentials

Change-Id: I4e1104f95cc3c7567ee8f6edfe8515d45d154a9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 17:50:21.000000000', 'message': "l3_ha: only pass host into update_port when updating router port bindings

There is a race condition in update_routers_states that may result in
some fixed ips incorrectly deallocated from router ports. This may
happen if update_routers_states fetches ports' state before another
thread updates the list; then update_routers_states passes port payloads
with old fixed ips into update_port, which results in ip address
deallocation. Among other things, l3 agent will detect the change and
remove the affected subnet prefix from radvd configuration file, since
it doesn't configure extra_subnets for RA.

There is no need to pass full port payload into update_port just to set
host. This patch replaces the payload with a dict of one key - host.
This allows core plugin to handle just this host field change, leaving
existing allocations (and other port attributes) intact.

Conflicts:
      neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Ib2c661d6e2cb8e34676fd83e19b6cf65c232545d
Closes-Bug: #1743658
(cherry picked from commit fea188acd173fe09e2e6f98534c4b9cb1523ebc6)
"}]
commit_message:
l3_ha: only pass host into update_port when updating router port bindings

There is a race condition in update_routers_states that may result in
some fixed ips incorrectly deallocated from router ports. This may
happen if update_routers_states fetches ports' state before another
thread updates the list; then update_routers_states passes port payloads
with old fixed ips into update_port, which results in ip address
deallocation. Among other things, l3 agent will detect the change and
remove the affected subnet prefix from radvd configuration file, since
it doesn't configure extra_subnets for RA.

There is no need to pass full port payload into update_port just to set
host. This patch replaces the payload with a dict of one key - host.
This allows core plugin to handle just this host field change, leaving
existing allocations (and other port attributes) intact.

Conflicts:
      neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Ib2c661d6e2cb8e34676fd83e19b6cf65c232545d
Closes-Bug: #1743658
(cherry picked from commit fea188acd173fe09e2e6f98534c4b9cb1523ebc6)

cipher and ivgen luks encryption params will be addressed in follow-up patches, right?'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-05-30 12:08:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks.
 > Looks like a good start.
 > 
 > cipher and ivgen luks encryption params will be addressed in
 > follow-up patches, right?

Cipher and ivgen are only used when initially formatting a LUKS device, with the values then being stored in the metadata of the volume after that. Libvirt only uses these when creating creating a LUKS volume, as we don't currently do that or plan to with this set of patches I don't think these are required."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-07 20:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
libvirt: Introduce disk encryption config classes

This change introduces the encryption and encryption secret config
classes required to allow for the native decryption of LUKS by QEMU.

implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: I84ff4368c3ecbb0954c12c2119cae30d11833393

commit_message:
Remove tempest-lib

tempest-lib was reintegrated into tempest in 2016, there's no need to
check it out anymore. Remove it from PROJECTS list.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I3ed33ad9cf4097bc48ab71a666c2ce95b26c3329

[{'created': '2017-04-26 17:55:38.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Refactor encryptor attach and detach calls

This change introduces new utility methods for attaching and detaching
frontend volume encryptors. These methods centralise the optional
fetching of encryption metadata associated with a volume, fetching of the
required encryptor and calls to detach or attach the encryptor.

Change-Id: Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

'}, {'created': '2018-01-08 19:34:53.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Collocate encryptor and volume driver calls

This change introduces new utility methods for attaching and detaching
frontend volume encryptors. These methods centralise the optional
fetching of encryption metadata associated with a volume, fetching of the
required encryptor and calls to detach or attach the encryptor.

These new utility methods are called either after initially connecting
to or before disconnecting from a volume. This ensures encryptors are
correctly connected when swapping volumes for example, where previously
no attempt was made to attach an encryptor to the target volume.

The request context is provided to swap_volume and various other config
generation related methods to allow for the lookup of the relevant
encryption metadata if it is not provided.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

commit_message:
libvirt: Collocate encryptor and volume driver calls

This change introduces new utility methods for attaching and detaching
frontend volume encryptors. These methods centralise the optional
fetching of encryption metadata associated with a volume, fetching of the
required encryptor and calls to detach or attach the encryptor.

These new utility methods are called either after initially connecting
to or before disconnecting from a volume. This ensures encryptors are
correctly connected when swapping volumes for example, where previously
no attempt was made to attach an encryptor to the target volume.

The request context is provided to swap_volume and various other config
generation related methods to allow for the lookup of the relevant
encryption metadata if it is not provided.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

commit_message:
add required projects for vmware-nsx periodic with neutron-lib

Commit Ic94010417fc702e2ebf62e29bb29c363af68d10c added the vmware-nsx
to the list of projects running the periodic neutron-lib jobs. However
this patch didn't include the required projects for vmware-nsx and
therefore the current periodic jobs are failing [1].

This patch adds the required projects for vmware-nsx as well as the
timeout value.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
vmware-nsx/master/legacy-periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/
f260bed/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-19_06_17_00_486231

Change-Id: I9bc58510962503c45f7996d707995666e616720a

commit_message:
FlashSystem: Add CMMVC6045E CLI error for multi-host mapping

Add CMMVC6045E to list of CLI error codes indicating a multi-host
map was attempted without the '-force' parameter. Re-raise on
match failure to avert spurious success when an unexcepted CLI
error is emitted. Add good and bad-path testing for multi-host
map to test_flashsystem_map_vdisk_to_host

Change-Id: I4b8d99966f387f51c1125ba72c1ce149229a8bc0
Closes-Bug: #1723188
(cherry picked from commit 421837ab4a3244022ad8292ad1ef0de37e9de532)

messages:
[{'account_id': 26464, 'date': '2017-12-31 14:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2017-12-31 14:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2017-12-31 14:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-12-31 16:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(28 comments)

Sorry for the number of comments... some of them repeat each other.

In addition, please add another change that moves the two http specs from vitrage-specs/specs/pike/approved to queens/implemented, and update their content.

Last, please add an rst file which details how to use the webhook, with a few examples of how to register and the format of the alarms that are sent. See as an example https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/master/doc/source/contributor/mistral-config.rst, and add a link to this file under https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/master/doc/source/contributor/configuration.rst'}, {'account_id': 26464, 'date': '2018-01-03 14:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26464, 'date': '2018-01-03 14:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26464, 'date': '2018-01-03 16:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18783, 'date': '2018-01-04 03:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:

get tokens from an identity server.

commit_message:
Account for deprecation of personality files

Personality files are deprecated as of v2.57:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522027

This patch adds version checks to test_serversV21 to account for the
deprecation.

Change-Id: I180e2c1a026ed1ebbd15bc7eb77e53aa960c228a

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: If3b4794e6f666686fbb6e234f81ae1ae98513fe8

commit_message:
agent extensions: support multiple detaches at the same time

Avoid the very suboptimal behavior we had when detaching
multiple prefixes for a port, where for each detach all the
not detached prefixes where refreshed.

Change-Id: Ia6b345cc1725fdbcea370c17c247ac209af3d3c7

commit_message:
Add keystoneauth adapters

Inspector sets API urls for ironic and swift from the config.
The better way would be to discovery them from the keystone
catalog.

Supporting this requires to register keystoneauth adapter
options to all config sections for service clients auth.
swiftclient still does not support adapter session client, so
pass all options from adapter explicitly.

New options were added 'service_type`, `service_name`, `region_name`
`endpoint_override`, `interfaces`.

Related-Bug: #1699547
Change-Id: I2e7ec02fdeeea21ef43136ddeabc98d499a8ba7f
Co-Authored-By: Anton Arefiev <aarefiev@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-12 03:56:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use docker_config_scripts for puppet apply

There are some configuration applies that we need to do during the
deployment. These currently live as manually constructed bash runs which
are missing the --detailed-exitcode handling to know when we have
failures.  In order to reduce the duplicated code and simplify this
exeuction, this change creates a docker_config_scripts with
docker_puppet_run.sh in containers-common that can be reused by any of
the docker services. This allows use to properly handle
--detailed-exitcodes while also reducing the amount of duplicated code
bits that we have within THT.

Additionally this change adds a new shared value for ContainersCommon to
pull the required volumes for the docker_puppet_apply.sh script into a
single place. Unfortunately the existing volumes from ContainersCommon
includes a mount for /etc/puppet to /etc/puppet which causes problems
because we need to be able to write out a hiera value.  The /etc/puppet
mount is needed for the bootstrap_host_exec function which is consumed
by various docker_config tasks but the mount conflicts with the puppet
apply logic being used.

Depends-On: I940cec6d670df39ac6e2a3559a028acbeee99331
Change-Id: Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca
Related-Bug: #1741345
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6f834f60e619181890c4438d1315ebaa776c1d09)
'}, {'created': '2018-01-12 16:47:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use docker_config_scripts for puppet apply

deployment. These currently live as manually constructed bash runs which
are missing the --detailed-exitcode handling to know when we have
failures.  In order to reduce the duplicated code and simplify this
exeuction, this change creates a docker_config_scripts with
docker_puppet_run.sh in containers-common that can be reused by any of
the docker services. This allows use to properly handle
--detailed-exitcodes while also reducing the amount of duplicated code
bits that we have within THT.

Additionally this change adds a new shared value for ContainersCommon to
pull the required volumes for the docker_puppet_apply.sh script into a
single place. Unfortunately the existing volumes from ContainersCommon
includes a mount for /etc/puppet to /etc/puppet which causes problems
because we need to be able to write out a hiera value.  The /etc/puppet
mount is needed for the bootstrap_host_exec function which is consumed
by various docker_config tasks but the mount conflicts with the puppet
apply logic being used.

Depends-On: I940cec6d670df39ac6e2a3559a028acbeee99331
Change-Id: Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca

commit_message:
Use docker_config_scripts for puppet apply

There are some configuration applies that we need to do during the
deployment. These currently live as manually constructed bash runs which
are missing the --detailed-exitcode handling to know when we have
failures.  In order to reduce the duplicated code and simplify this
exeuction, this change creates a docker_config_scripts with
docker_puppet_run.sh in containers-common that can be reused by any of
the docker services. This allows use to properly handle
--detailed-exitcodes while also reducing the amount of duplicated code
bits that we have within THT.

Additionally this change adds a new shared value for ContainersCommon to
pull the required volumes for the docker_puppet_apply.sh script into a
single place. Unfortunately the existing volumes from ContainersCommon
includes a mount for /etc/puppet to /etc/puppet which causes problems
because we need to be able to write out a hiera value.  The /etc/puppet
mount is needed for the bootstrap_host_exec function which is consumed
by various docker_config tasks but the mount conflicts with the puppet
apply logic being used.

Depends-On: I940cec6d670df39ac6e2a3559a028acbeee99331
Change-Id: Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca
Related-Bug: #1741345
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6f834f60e619181890c4438d1315ebaa776c1d09)

commit_message:
Adds TLS support for OpenDaylight

Allows enabling TLS for the ODL service as well as OVS.

Partially-Implements: blueprint opendaylight-ssl-support

Depends-On: I719e8dddbd00d19fd8e1bd2a20dabd600b7b9d1c

Change-Id: Id579aea77bf8d679b514ef9851af36d9170e93a1
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-10-26 13:20:46.000000000', 'message': 'Run Octavia configuration on the overcloud

Fully configuring Octavia requires resources such as the load balancer
management network and amphora image to be created in the overcloud
during deployment. This is handled through some ansible driven through a
mistral workflow. This patch enables configuring and triggering this
workflow from heat.

Co-Authored-By: Brent Eagles <beagles@redhat.com>
Depends-on: If07ded033be9f44b7c7a7e09214032fa89a02e77

commit_message:
Run Octavia configuration on the overcloud

Fully configuring Octavia requires resources such as the load balancer
management network and amphora image to be created in the overcloud
during deployment. This is handled through some ansible driven through a
mistral workflow. This patch enables configuring and triggering this
workflow from heat.

Co-Authored-By: Brent Eagles <beagles@redhat.com>
Depends-on: If07ded033be9f44b7c7a7e09214032fa89a02e77

Change-Id: I2d10dbd33b3a0ed0463096849d01aa2c1b9f293e

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-04-08 22:37:27.000000000', 'message': "Guard against post-as-copy flattening large objects

Previously, if a user POSTed to a large object and the cluster had
POST-as-COPY enabled, the entire contents of the large object would be
copied, rather than having the manifest copied in place. This had
several negative effects; such a POST:

 * was slower than necessary;
 * left orphaned segments, doubling storage utilization; and
 * would fail with Entity Too Large errors if the complete object was
   larger than max_file_size.

Now, POSTing to an object through the CLI or SwiftService API will
automatically include a ?multipart-manifest=get query parameter to
prevent this. Additionally, Connection API users may use the new
query_string argument to put_object to include an arbitrary query
string.

NOTE: pre-1.13.1 clusters do not automatically preserve a DLO's
X-Object-Manifest header when POSTing/COPYing.

Change-Id: I3158b608746ebd17f6f4181be51d024d0f7de90c
Related-Change: I1073af9fee6e34ebdfad7b1a89aeb05e4523a151
Related-Bug: 1487791

commit_message:
Guard against post-as-copy flattening large objects

Previously, if a user POSTed to a large object and the cluster had
POST-as-COPY enabled, the entire contents of the large object would be
copied, rather than having the manifest copied in place. This had
several negative effects; such a POST:

 * was slower than necessary;
 * left orphaned segments, doubling storage utilization; and
 * would fail with Entity Too Large errors if the complete object was
   larger than max_file_size.

Now, when POSTing to an object through the CLI or SwiftService API,
automatically include a ?multipart-manifest=get query parameter to
prevent this. This will only be included if the target cluster is
running swift 1.13.1 or later; earlier versions would not automatically
preserve X-Object-Manifest headers during POSTs.

Additionally, Connection API users may use the new query_string argument
to post_object to include an arbitrary query string, regardless of
cluster version.

Change-Id: I3158b608746ebd17f6f4181be51d024d0f7de90c
Related-Change: I1073af9fee6e34ebdfad7b1a89aeb05e4523a151
Related-Bug: 1487791

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.7

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I3654eca99bbf1e2d44f70ded707fae22a2d05788

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 22:37:42.000000000', 'message': "l3_ha: only pass host into update_port when updating router port bindings

There is a race condition in update_routers_states that may result in
some fixed ips incorrectly deallocated from router ports. This may
happen if update_routers_states fetches ports' state before another
thread updates the list; then update_routers_states passes port payloads
with old fixed ips into update_port, which results in ip address
deallocation. Among other things, l3 agent will detect the change and
remove the affected subnet prefix from radvd configuration file, since
it doesn't configure extra_subnets for RA.

There is no need to pass full port payload into update_port just to set
host. This patch replaces the payload with a dict of one key - host.
This allows core plugin to handle just this host field change, leaving
existing allocations (and other port attributes) intact.

Change-Id: Ib2c661d6e2cb8e34676fd83e19b6cf65c232545d
Closes-Bug: #1743658
"}]
commit_message:
l3_ha: only pass host into update_port when updating router port bindings

There is a race condition in update_routers_states that may result in
some fixed ips incorrectly deallocated from router ports. This may
happen if update_routers_states fetches ports' state before another
thread updates the list; then update_routers_states passes port payloads
with old fixed ips into update_port, which results in ip address
deallocation. Among other things, l3 agent will detect the change and
remove the affected subnet prefix from radvd configuration file, since
it doesn't configure extra_subnets for RA.

There is no need to pass full port payload into update_port just to set
host. This patch replaces the payload with a dict of one key - host.
This allows core plugin to handle just this host field change, leaving
existing allocations (and other port attributes) intact.

Change-Id: Ib2c661d6e2cb8e34676fd83e19b6cf65c232545d
Closes-Bug: #1743658

This PS adds Ceph OSD's to the host specific over-rides, it also
simplifies the host-specific daemonset logic.

commit_message:
Handle a resource delete race condition

When a resource is deleted from it's detail page, it returns to it's
parent page and also returns the action result. The detail page action
handler should ignore the delete event and thus not trying to load the
already deleted resource.

Change-Id: I5b4b33b5ea5716e5f005d388d68c9ecbcf09e2f9

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

This change also breaks the inheritance between
HorizonHAProxyContext and HAProxyContext (as this was
not needed) and aligns the code in HorizonHAProxyContext
to the behaviour in HAProxyContext of using get_relation_ip
instead of unit_get.

Change-Id: I72600b01744a07e140a29255efc2823ea39ce730
