[{'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-04 17:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-01-04 19:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this fixes v2, what about v1? 

a release note could also be added'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:17:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I can't be certain, but to my knowledge v1 is deprecated and unsupported. It means that we fix only related critical and security bugs https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/versions.py#L87-L100

Regarding to the release note, in my understanding this is just a small bug-fix, which brings the openstackclient's work in line with native client's shell: https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/v2/shell.py#L356
Do you really think we need an official announcement?"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-01-05 14:27:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I can't be certain, but to my knowledge v1 is deprecated and
 > unsupported. It means that we fix only related critical and
 > security bugs https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/versions.py#L87-L100

Correct, but that's the server side. Last time dtroyer checked, OSC v3.x worked for versions os openstack server as far back as grizzly (or havana or icehouse?), so even though the server side of glace v1 has deprecated for a while, there are still some deployments of it that use latest OSC that would benefit from the fix.

 > 
 > Regarding to the release note, in my understanding this is just a
 > small bug-fix, which brings the openstackclient's work in line with
 > native client's shell: https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/v2/shell.py#L356
 > Do you really think we need an official announcement?

I'm OK without it, i guess, we tend to create a release note for any bug that is user facing, which this one is."}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Steve. I checked v1 - it works well and raises NotFound error.
v1: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v1/images.py#L515
v2: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/image_data.py#L464 

Also I added a small release note as you asked.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

thank you!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-08 03:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-09 10:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-01-22 15:21:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

v1 also needs to be fixed.  Clients have a different deprecation schedule, ie, we suport Image v1 until it is reasonable no longer in use in the field.  that's going to be a while yet.

Our policy for critical fixes only applies to OSC stable releases independent of API version."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-01-22 15:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Nevermind me, v1 not afffected'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 17:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'Check that Glance returns image data before processing it

Now if Glance cannot find image data it returns an empty
response with 204 status code, instead of raising an error.

Glance client handles this situation and wraps the response
with a RequestIdProxy object, whose 'wrapped' attribute is
None.

But when openstack client tries to parse this object using
glanceclient's save_image util function, it fails with
"NoneType object is not iterable" message, for the
object doesn't contain any data.

This patch adds additional check to prevent such behaviour
and raises SystemExit exception if no data was returned from
the server.

Change-Id: I016a60462ba586f9fa7585c2cfafffd7be38de7b
Closes-Bug: #1741223
'}, {'created': '2018-01-05 18:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Check that Glance returns image data before processing it

Now if Glance v2 cannot find image data it returns an empty
response with 204 status code, instead of raising an error.

Glance client handles this situation and wraps the response
with a RequestIdProxy object, whose 'wrapped' attribute is
None.

But when openstack client tries to parse this object using
glanceclient's save_image util function, it fails with
"NoneType object is not iterable" message, for the
object doesn't contain any data.

This patch adds additional check to prevent such behaviour
and raises SystemExit exception if no data was returned from
the server.

Glance v1 is not affected, because it raises an error if can't

Change-Id: I016a60462ba586f9fa7585c2cfafffd7be38de7b
Closes-Bug: #1741223
'}]
commit_message:
Check that Glance returns image data before processing it

Now if Glance v2 cannot find image data it returns an empty
response with 204 status code, instead of raising an error.

Glance client handles this situation and wraps the response
with a RequestIdProxy object, whose 'wrapped' attribute is
None.

But when openstack client tries to parse this object using
glanceclient's save_image util function, it fails with
"NoneType object is not iterable" message, for the
object doesn't contain any data.

This patch adds additional check to prevent such behaviour
and raises SystemExit exception if no data was returned from
the server.

Glance v1 is not affected, because it raises an error if can't
find an image data.

Change-Id: I016a60462ba586f9fa7585c2cfafffd7be38de7b
Closes-Bug: #1741223

commit_message:
Adopted to new oslo.context code to remove deprecation warnings

The following deprecation warnings are gone with the patch:

Using the 'user' argument is deprecated in version '2.18' and will be
removed in version '3.0', please use the 'user_id' argument instead

Using the 'tenant' argument is deprecated in version '2.18' and will be
removed in version '3.0', please use the 'project_id' argument instead

Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'user' has moved to 'user_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'domain' has moved to 'domain_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'user_domain' has moved to 'user_domain_id' in version '2.6'
and will be removed in version '3.0'

Property 'project_domain' has moved to 'project_domain_id' in version
'2.6' and will be removed in version '3.0'

Change-Id: I0acda6e319c261c31ec553169ac099cd2ab28743
Partial-Bug: #1744363

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Implement IPv6 support for Manila Dell EMC Unity driver

Major changes:
  * Support to create/delete/extend/access NFS and CIFS share/snapshot
    in the IPv6 network which created by Neutron
  * Support to connect Unity management interface using IPv6 address

Change-Id: I590d569c6fe1a0f8b146bec9c74513269b8358f4
Implements: blueprint unity-manila-ipv6-support

commit_message:
Refactored cinder tempest tests to cinder_tempest_plugin

* As per the current codebase of cinder tempest plugin, it is getting
  dumped in the cinder/tests and the package name is setup.cfg is
  cinder_tempest_plugin which does not exists. So i refactored to
  give a proper tempest plugin shape.

Change-Id: Ia78ea53a99923844f40fb4e9fe22ec0da4b0c335

commit_message:
log: augment json records

The ContextFormatter gathers more information about the request than
the JSONFormatter, which is rather opposite to what one might expect.
This patch pulls that logic out into a separate method allowing it to
be reused.

Change-Id: I27d9001150ec563fc7972a5b9ea6b55270ab652f

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 21:33:31.000000000', 'message': "Fixed _log_console_output call on failure

_log_console_output is defined in tempest.scenario.manager.Manager but
the test class inherited from BaseTestCase that doesn't have it. So
whenever a test failure occurs, we don't log console output, which may
be handy when debugging gate issues.

Change-Id: I48701da8714c9e483401fd1ba987e4f2bef5bd23
Related-Bug: #1742936
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed _log_console_output call on failure

_log_console_output is defined in tempest.scenario.manager.Manager but
the test class inherited from BaseTestCase that doesn't have it. So
whenever a test failure occurs, we don't log console output, which may
be handy when debugging gate issues.

Change-Id: I48701da8714c9e483401fd1ba987e4f2bef5bd23
Related-Bug: #1742936

And depends on a nova patch to fix a problem with creating
a server snapshot image from a paused instance when we're
not using the Pike UCA:

commit_message:
tests: Use mock autospec in unit tests

Autospecing will ensure that the method signatures are respected
during calls.

oslotest.mock_fixture contains 2 components, one of them adds the autospec
argument to mock.Mock and mock.MagicMock, while the other one fixes the
autospec behaviour for mock.patch functions, and sets autospec to True by
default, unless otherwise specified.

Closes-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I5a1dd8571988859b4a14a505fd5e016079582363

'}, {'created': '2018-01-22 09:38:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add --wsrep-new-cluster option back in the bootstrap_db function

Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5 removed the
"--wsrep-new-cluster" option and left "--wsrep-on=OFF".
But it seems "--wsrep-on=OFF" won't work with mariadb 10.0. and In
Ubuntu, we are still using mariadb 10.0.

Try to add --wsrep-new-cluster back

Change-Id: I4d382d1b9c83def62dc85a773580c8c6b2500f68
'}]
commit_message:
Add --wsrep-new-cluster option back in the bootstrap_db function

Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5 removed the
"--wsrep-new-cluster" option and left "--wsrep-on=OFF".
But it seems "--wsrep-on=OFF" won't work with mariadb 10.0. and In
Ubuntu, we are still using mariadb 10.0.

Try to add --wsrep-new-cluster back

Change-Id: I4d382d1b9c83def62dc85a773580c8c6b2500f68

commit_message:
Follow troveclient zuul job rename

Rename zuul v3 job to follow naming conventions.

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed for in-tree zuul
files anymore.

Depends-On: Id2aed659c1fcb7333b7efa4dc0a019d21bdcd51a
Change-Id: I2dd2075e41680d7b85d574575a19531599dabf5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 16:33:58.000000000', 'message': '[Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles

The named pipe handler provided by os-win is used by Nova when
consuming instance serial ports. For convenience, it allows logging
the named pipe output to a file (useful for storing the serial
console output).

The issue is that the log file never gets flushed, thus Nova returns
incomplete results. This change adds a method that may be used for
flushing the log file.

Change-Id: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
Closes-Bug: #1741494
'}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles

The named pipe handler provided by os-win is used by Nova when
consuming instance serial ports. For convenience, it allows logging
the named pipe output to a file (useful for storing the serial
console output).

The issue is that the log file never gets flushed, thus Nova returns
incomplete results. This change adds a method that may be used for
flushing the log file.

Change-Id: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
Closes-Bug: #1741494

commit_message:
Blueprint for Blazar integration with OSA

Blazar is the resource reservation project for OpenStack.
This blueprint describe the steps required to make
it available as a service for OpenStack Ansible.

Change-Id: Ibe345ce18b7b4f28886ef5333478e1d3d043ac4a
Signed-off-by: Taseer Ahmed <taseer94@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 17:04:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for CephFS Native Manila backend

One change that affects all manila backends is the configuration of the
enabled_share_protocols. This defaults to "NFS, CIFS", which I have
maintained for the existing backends. When it comes to the CephFS native
driver we need to add CEPHFS into the list.

Generally this has copied the pattern used in glance to support
connecting to an external ceph system, mixed with the existing way
manila backends are enabled.

Change-Id: If1c4307d47c3607a97c8b32d3f06fc64e80e94b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for CephFS Native Manila backend

One change that affects all manila backends is the configuration of the
enabled_share_protocols. This defaults to "NFS, CIFS", which I have
maintained for the existing backends. When it comes to the CephFS native
driver we need to add CEPHFS into the list.

Generally this has copied the pattern used in glance to support
connecting to an external ceph system, mixed with the existing way
manila backends are enabled.

Change-Id: If1c4307d47c3607a97c8b32d3f06fc64e80e94b4

commit_message:
Microversion 2.58 - Instance actions list pagination

Add optional parameters 'limit', 'marker' and 'changes-since' to the
os-instance-actions endpoints for pagination.

Implement: blueprint pagination-add-changes-since-for-instance-action-list

Change-Id: Ie66d9b00c90236fdcc01aed7649dc7f163aa323e

commit_message:
Add support for the 2.57 microversion

With the 2.57 microversion, we:

* Deprecate the --file option from the nova boot and
  nova rebuild CLIs and API bindings.
* Add --user-data and --user-data-unset to the nova rebuild
  CLI and API bindings.
* Deprecate the maxPersonality and maxPersonalitySize fields
  from the nova limits and nova absolute-limits CLIs and API
  bindings.
* Deprecate injected_files, injected_file_content_bytes, and
  injected_file_path_bytes from the nova quota-show,
  nova quota-update, nova quota-defaults, nova quota-class-show,
  and nova quota-class-update CLIs and API bindings.

Part of blueprint deprecate-file-injection

Change-Id: Id13e3eac3ef87d429454042ac7046e865774ff8e

commit_message:
Create nl04.o.o configuration

Move our OVH provider to nl04.o.o (from nl02). This will allow us to
reduce the CPU usage on nl02.o.o.

Change-Id: I2d52e7d7c05a49b01b5538bf60630003b6aabad6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 14:10:15.000000000', 'message': "Vagrantfile: Use rync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy.

Change-Id: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
"}, {'created': '2018-01-17 14:12:44.000000000', 'message': "Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy.

Change-Id: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
"}, {'created': '2018-01-19 11:26:55.000000000', 'message': "Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy. This also restores the missing new line
at the end of the test-log-collect.sh script which got removed in
I4475e4dfe13acb4c88444f1f7aa88272bf87f6ee in order to make the linters
happy.

Change-Id: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
"}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy. This also restores the missing new line
at the end of the test-log-collect.sh script which got removed in
I4475e4dfe13acb4c88444f1f7aa88272bf87f6ee in order to make the linters
happy.

Change-Id: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366

commit_message:
Adds NIC hardware offload support

Adds get_nic_hardware_offload_info method in hostutils, which
will return a list of dictionaries containing details regarding
different NIC hardware offload capacities for SR-IOV, IOV queue
pairs, VMQs, IPsec SAs.

Adds set_vswitch_port_offload method in networkutils, which will
set the given hardware offload options into the given switch port
(enable / disable SR-IOV or VMQ, set IOV queues, set offloaded IPsec
SAs).

Implements: blueprint nic-hardware-offload

Change-Id: Ib2915bd4fe050b97597799f359b310eef7457c58

commit_message:
Disable Active Port Detection when using ZMQ

Currently Active Port Detection and ZMQ have port collision.
This patch disables Active Port Detection when using ZMQ
in our suggested local.conf

Change-Id: I08fafee1e2f7ea31f89ca98904ee786e3b2b0747
Related-Bug: #1716933

commit_message:
Guest agent won't start on Xenial Percona 5.7

Trove guest agent on Ubuntu Xenial Percona 5.7 image won't start
because of a missing header/section in "/etc/mysql/my.cnf" file.

To fix that, we only have to check if a section exists, if not
a [mysql] section is automatically created.

Change-Id: If3b1166fc04985763ae522f5eac022d53f2a366f
Closes-Bug: #1744107

[{'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:33:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:29:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-07 20:04:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-10113 : FAILURE in 2h 08m 43s'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-12 13:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-12 14:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-10516 : SUCCESS in 55m 18s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-12-12 14:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/526356/4/ : FAILURE in 1h 05m 30s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-19 00:55:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think what you're trying to fix is a duplicate of what I'm trying to fix here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528835/

If we're hitting this because of a reschedule failure, the build request should already be gone and we shouldn't even try to clean it up."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-19 00:56:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The build request isn't in a cell, it's in the API database, so this won't fix your issue. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528835/ for what I think we should be doing."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-19 09:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528835/'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-01-22 09:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Matt the code that you added does not solve the issue and when the invalid vnic is returned the same issue occurs'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-22 15:56:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> @Matt the code that you added does not solve the issue and when the invalid vnic is returned the same issue occurs

I don't know how that's possible. My change will only try to delete the build request if we're not rescheduling from a failed compute (like in the case of a scheduling failure using cells v1), and an invalid vnic is something that would trigger a reschedule from a failed compute."}]

commit_message:
Conductor: ensure build cleanup works with cells

Make use of the cell mapping for the instance build cleanup. This
was not dealt with correctly in the event that libvirt failed to
deploy an instance, for example with invalid vnic type passed by
Neutron.

Change-Id: Ie8145d9c659d1918fd7910a10aa32a605d892943
Closes-Bug: #1736946

[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-09 19:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-09 19:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-01-09 19:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This (whole series) should be done using ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree() [1] once available.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521187/

Let me know if you have any questions.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-10 09:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This (whole series) should be done using ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree()
 > [1] once available.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521187/
 > 
 > Let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks for the review Eric. The spec[1] on which this change is based states that this work would not use update_provider_tree, to avoid adding a dependency on that work.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/ironic-driver-traits.html#alternatives'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-01-10 15:08:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> The spec[1] on which this change is based states that this work would not 
> use update_provider_tree, to avoid adding a dependency on that work.

Hmph, I was even a reviewer on that spec.  I blame December.

Okay, so I'm not a big fan of the idea of adding a compute driver method that's only going to be used in this one corner case, and only temporarily until update_provider_tree is baked and consumable.  I'm also vaguely worried about how get_traits will coordinate with update_provider_tree - I suppose get_traits will go hand in hand with get_inventory, and the update_provider_tree path will ignore both of those.

But if this was what we agreed on in the spec..."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-10 15:43:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add get_traits() method to ComputeDriver

The get_traits() virt driver method can be used by virt driver
implementations to advertise the traits that are associated with the
resource provider representing a given compute node. If implemented, the
method should return an iterable of traits.

blueprint ironic-driver-traits

Change-Id: If395389af8aacb4dd9666e7af234891de1a7f1af

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 15:37:49.000000000', 'message': "Reducing tempest_workers to 1 for fs016

Usually, the concurrency is set to number of cpus / 2, however we are
seeing parallelism issues with this particular featureset when run tests
in parallel. So, let's test running the jobs without parallelism for
now.

Change-Id: Ieedde8797e8c9312e073366e0fabe31ca7482775
Related-To: #1742936
"}]
commit_message:
Reducing tempest_workers to 1 for fs016

Usually, the concurrency is set to number of cpus / 2, however we are
seeing parallelism issues with this particular featureset when run tests
in parallel. So, let's test running the jobs without parallelism for
now.

Change-Id: Ieedde8797e8c9312e073366e0fabe31ca7482775
Related-To: #1742936

'}, {'created': '2017-11-08 13:29:57.000000000', 'message': "Implements AIDE Intrusion Detection System

Introduces a service to configure AIDE Intrusion Detection.

This service init's the database and copies the new database
to the active naming. It also sets a cron job, using email if
`AideEmail` is populated, otherwise the reports are sent to
`/var/log/aide/`.

AIDE rules can be supplied as a hash, and should the rules ever
be changed, the service will populate the new rules and re-init
a fresh integrity database.

Change-Id: I23d8ba2c43e907372fe079026df1fca5fa1c9881
"}, {'created': '2017-11-08 15:47:16.000000000', 'message': "Implements AIDE Intrusion Detection System

Introduces a service to configure AIDE Intrusion Detection.

This service init's the database and copies the new database
to the active naming. It also sets a cron job, using email if
`AideEmail` is populated, otherwise the reports are sent to
`/var/log/aide/`.

AIDE rules can be supplied as a hash, and should the rules ever
be changed, the service will populate the new rules and re-init
a fresh integrity database.

commit_message:
Implements AIDE Intrusion Detection System

Introduces a service to configure AIDE Intrusion Detection.

This service init's the database and copies the new database
to the active naming. It also sets a cron job, using email if
`AideEmail` is populated, otherwise the reports are sent to
`/var/log/aide/`.

AIDE rules can be supplied as a hash, and should the rules ever
be changed, the service will populate the new rules and re-init
a fresh integrity database.

Related-Blueprint: tripleo-aide-database
Depends-On: Iac2ceb7fc6b610f8920ae6f75faa2885f3edf6eb
Change-Id: I23d8ba2c43e907372fe079026df1fca5fa1c9881

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-11 00:53:49.000000000', 'message': 'Include Filepath Opt

Currently there is no dedicated config opt type for config options
that take file paths or directory paths are values. Hence, many
projects are forced to use "StrOpt" and perform validation for the

commit_message:
Introduce Filepath Opt

Currently there is no dedicated config opt type for config options
that take file paths or directory paths as values. Hence, many
projects are forced to use "StrOpt" and perform validation for the
file/directory path in the project.

This patch adds a new opt type "FilepathOpt" that takes either a
valid file path or directory path, thereby taking load of validation
off the depending projects.

Closes-Bug: #1677422

Change-Id: If67eb72c0055e3d6533d17943c76ed89982ad26d

commit_message:
Add more UndercloudCinder services to auto eval

If UndercloudCinderScheduler/volume services present
in the resources registry, auto avaluate required
docker images as well.
Follows-up I1b8b32ad62c96fcacb463f9e9ac483254ee325c9 .

Change-Id: If1db6f7f5904f87210c74d5be40dc58f4677e7a5
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6. Support
was retained for v9.4. To do this, some refactoring of trovestack
was undertaken; specifically, the VERSION and PACKAGE variable
determination was moved from cmd_set_datastore to a new function,
set_datastore_version_info(). This allows for the VERSION variable
to be used in the elements as well as at datastore add time.

this:
VERSION=9.4 ./trovestack kick-start postgresql

"checkpoint_segments" is no longer supported. The v9.4 version
of the file was retained and moved to a "9.4" directory which
will be detected during instance launch resulting in the correct
version of the file being sent to the instance.

commit_message:
Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6. Support
was retained for v9.4. To do this, some refactoring of trovestack
was undertaken; specifically, the VERSION and PACKAGE variable
determination was moved from cmd_set_datastore to a new function,
set_datastore_version_info(). This allows for the VERSION variable
to be used in the elements as well as at datastore add time.
The default for Postgresql will now be v9.6. v9.4 can be built like
this:
VERSION=9.4 ./trovestack kick-start postgresql

The config.template needed to be changed because the parameter
"checkpoint_segments" is no longer supported. The v9.4 version
of the file was retained and moved to a "9.4" directory which
will be detected during instance launch resulting in the correct
version of the file being sent to the instance.

Closes-bug: 1649084
Change-Id: Ia1c71d55cc25f544436e725869bac839d95e988e

commit_message:
rehome shared constant

The SHARED constant is used in a number of projects [1]. This patch
rehomes the constant to neutron-lib for consumption and switches all
neutron-lib static uses of 'shared' to use the new constant.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=att.*%5C.SHARED

Change-Id: If123044496b54a8bfc115ab41b8506ec5d7ba5a3

commit_message:
Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)

Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'

Replace 'assertTrue(a in b)' with 'assertIn(a, b)'

[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality. Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertEqual(...) is preferred over assertTrue(... == ...), and
assertNotEqual(...) is preferred over assertFalse(... == ...).
Off by default.

see more https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: Ic21fa755faf218bc1c27dc9c839cf6f99f67d287

commit_message:
Update zuul.yaml

Rename tempest job to follow our naming for in-tree jobs since
we have a global shared namespace.

Rename ansible jobs for naming conventions, it needs to start with
dragonflow.

Remove legacy job here, it's in project-config and non-converted legacy
jobs should not be in the repo, it needs to be properly imported first.

Naming conventions reference:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Remove name from project stanza, it's not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I1f5f54ce3e70307541c78ba86f16086d38e877e8

commit_message:
CNI Daemon documentation

This commit extends developer docs to add information about CNI Daemon
and APIs between CNI Driver and CNI Daemon.

Implements: blueprint cni-split-exec-daemon
Co-Authored-By: Janonymous <janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Rename jobs for zuul v3

Follow naming conventions from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3
to have jobs start with project-name since we share a global namespace.

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I3f49442a097b8290e75d12a939a1e65528263cec

Hopefully we will have new microversion negotiation logic available to us in the next release. In this case though, we don't appear to upgrade the actual version of nova... so i'm unsure how bumping the minimum version will actually block us down the line with this since newer nova shouldn't be present. The altered/incompatible libraries (which in itself is a whole other issue) case though, is definitely a possibility. I seem to remember active discussion recently as to the meaning of first class citizenship in openstack and the predications that the tools like grenade have placed in term of sequence. All things Ironic has encountered, now that other smaller projects are hitting some of the same issues, perhaps it is time.... commit_message:
Always attempt to restart n-cpu/n-cond

During the upgrade sequence, as other services are
down or unavailable while processes are upgrading,
a number of errors are generated in the nova-compute
logging. This appears to possibly be a result of the
nova-conductor process failing and entering a loop
where it is continiously trying to restart.

As such, we need to always attempt to restart the
nova-compute and conductor services on the primary
node.

Closes-Bug: #1744139
Change-Id: I14cd8bfd20bd66efdad77e658a72bf5471a0f3d4

Before proposing this patch i reproduced this in ocata using reproduce_quickstart.sh. Since issue is faced in ovb jobs running on rdocloud, Issue reproduction can be done as follows:-

Reboot it: sudo reboot

commit_message:
Set SUPERMIN_* variables to working kernel

virt-customize(libguestfs) is not working with current
kernel 3.10.0-693.11.6.el7 in centos.
So until it's fixed in libguestfs or kernel, let's
use working kernel 3.10.0-693.el7.x86_64.
The kernel version is managed using following variable
which can be overridden when required.
Libguesfs requires following environment variables
to use the overridden kernel.

- SUPERMIN_KERNEL_VERSION: {{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}
- SUPERMIN_KERNEL: /boot/vmlinuz-{{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}
- SUPERMIN_MODULES: /lib/modules/{{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}

Change-Id: I129ec6c48d801cd605c4befda5ee00a025480413
Partial-Bug: #1743749

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: Ib62da7388ac16da44f7a1aa13c3cc7e928daa2e6
Partial-Bug: #1741634

Fixed the typos local.

Yeah, I'm kind of driving forward on this in a "brute force" mode for now. I welcome follow on patches that switch this to packages.  At least for ubuntu my issue with the cloud archives is they are a big dis-joint with the OS release, i.e. the pike CA is against artful. If you have pointers to get packages that are clean for the release and don't taint the rest of the packages, I'm all for it.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-18 23:33:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-18 23:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Yes, repositories are "fun" to handle properly (and even more with multiple distributions). So far, I have not found a better way than https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522626/, which is mostly leave it up to packagers to have proper versions available when the script runs.

This could probably be enhanced by some post-install validation steps (check version output from binaries), but for setting up the repositories, I think it will probably stay out of the elements'}]

commit_message:
ACTIVE-ACTIVE: OVS diskimage-builder element

This patch adds OVS to the amphora image via a new diskimage-builder element.

It also minimizes the image by managing the build tools installation and
uninstallation as well as removing the source git checkouts.

This patch is a re-work of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403594/

Change-Id: Ib1b584937184645f79fc7bdf6b858cf00df704e9
Co-Authored-By: Valeria Perelman <perelman@il.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Banashankar K Veerad <bkalebe@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Abed Abu dbai <abeda@il.ibm.com>

subject: Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 09:18:37.000000000', 'message': 'Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features

Adding new features to support VNF deployment in form of ACTIVE members
and STANDBY members in cluster that guarantee High Availability to required
VNF in Tacker env.
This implementation enable some cluster-related operation such as: VNF
cluster and VNF cluster-member CRUD operations.
On the other hand, this implementation also introduce a new "respawn"
action in policy action whose name "recovery". "Recovery" action will
be triggered in the event of receiving event from monitoring drivers. The
recovery scenarios is depend on asssigned role of the failed cluster-member
in the system.
- In the case of failed cluster-member has ACTIVE role-> bring existing
STANDBY member up to ACTIVE member -> deploy a new STANDBY member -> delete
the failed member
- In the case of failed cluster-member has STANDBY role -> deploy a new
STANDBY member -> delete a failed member.

Change-Id: I5b1c44a073f30552c46962441189d724239315b1
blueprint: policy-based-vnf-cluster
Co-Authored-By: xuan0802 <thespring1989@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features

Adding new features to support VNF deployment in form of ACTIVE members
and STANDBY members in cluster that guarantee High Availability to required
VNF in Tacker env.
This implementation enable some cluster-related operation such as: VNF
cluster and VNF cluster-member CRUD operations.
On the other hand, this implementation also introduce a new "respawn"
action in policy action whose name "recovery". "Recovery" action will
be triggered in the event of receiving event from monitoring drivers. The
recovery scenarios is depend on asssigned role of the failed cluster-member
in the system.
- In the case of failed cluster-member has ACTIVE role-> bring existing
STANDBY member up to ACTIVE member -> deploy a new STANDBY member -> delete
the failed member
- In the case of failed cluster-member has STANDBY role -> deploy a new
STANDBY member -> delete a failed member.

Change-Id: I5b1c44a073f30552c46962441189d724239315b1
blueprint: policy-based-vnf-cluster
Co-Authored-By: xuan0802 <thespring1989@gmail.com>

Multiple updates on the router could lead to stale data.

'}, {'created': '2018-01-19 13:17:43.000000000', 'message': "Include P-Q changes into the upgrade script

We need to include changes in the upgrade script to handle
the changes done during the Queens timeframe:

- Inventory is fixed to prevent a stacktrace if a container
  default was moved from is_metal: False to is_metal: True,
  and now respects existing container properties.
- Ensuring previous inventory location isn't overriding the
  Queens inventory location in memory, by unsetting
  ANSIBLE_INVENTORY.
- Ensuring all containers are using the repo that was build
  during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I0fd3a8803bf345ccad07dc97968e104cd0a7bf70
Partial-Bug: #1741462
Closes-Bug: #1675810
"}]
commit_message:
Include P-Q changes into the upgrade script

We need to include changes in the upgrade script to handle
the changes done during the Queens timeframe:

- Inventory is fixed to prevent a stacktrace if a container
  default was moved from is_metal: False to is_metal: True,
  and now respects existing container properties.
- Ensuring previous inventory location isn't overriding the
  Queens inventory location in memory, by unsetting
  ANSIBLE_INVENTORY.
- Ensuring all containers are using the repo that was build
  during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I0fd3a8803bf345ccad07dc97968e104cd0a7bf70
Partial-Bug: #1741462
Closes-Bug: #1675810

commit_message:
Add test case for listing Statistics without end time

Statisics api fails when no end time is present with Casssandra.
Added a test case that queries statistics without specifying end time.

Change-Id: I627c4e461a755ae982dcd78cf22d754c33480b71
story: 2001461
task: 6176

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 10:06:17.000000000', 'message': 'Run docker-puppet.py in debug mode.

Allow running docker-puppet.py in
debug mode, depending on the value
of the ansible variable docker_puppet_debug.

This variable takes its value from DockerPuppetDebug,
which is set to true in the env file
environments/config-debug.yaml.

Change-Id: I7c88aa22dce3396c6a79843ac13db479ed987f9d
'}]
commit_message:
Run docker-puppet.py in debug mode.

Allow running docker-puppet.py in
debug mode, depending on the value
of the ansible variable docker_puppet_debug.

This variable takes its value from DockerPuppetDebug,
which is set to true in the env file
environments/config-debug.yaml.

Change-Id: I7c88aa22dce3396c6a79843ac13db479ed987f9d

commit_message:
bgpvpn: agent extension, fix port association 'routes' update

This change fixes the code to handle port association updates:
if an update adds routes and removes routes, we were
only detaching removed routes.

Change-Id: Ib8c7d3162d5322702ad6a149f903b1c705daabd8
Closes-Bug: 1743574

subject: Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref
messages:
[{'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-04 08:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-04 21:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

There also appears to be some other typos that could get cleaned up as part of this.
For example the "delay" param still uses a str in some cases: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/api-ref/source/v2/samples/lbaas/healthmonitor-create-request.json#L5'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2018-01-05 01:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-05 13:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-08 07:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-08 13:39:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the info, but I'm still a little confused.
I see the provisioning_status in the db model, but not in the extended resources for the extension.


At the end of the day IMO the resource definition should match the API. So if provisioning_status is returned for pools, then it should be in the resource attr map, and vice-versa.


This applies to all attributes/params for lbaas."}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-09 02:33:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think we should expose provisioning_status and operating_status for all attributes/params for lbaas. I find a patch to fix it[1], but it isn't merged. 
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/405780/"}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-09 13:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So maybe this neutron-lib patch should depend on I7622e353846134795f28ffb03ddb2f976008779e since the later adds support for the API changes described herein?'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-10 07:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I can wait for the patch, or I can change my patch to delete status param to make the document fit the current program. Which do you think be better?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:48:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If the implementation will land before too long, the maybe easiest just to have this depend on the patch.


On the other hand if it's a long way out, maybe reflect the current API.


Just my 2 cents."}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-15 03:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-15 06:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-16 13:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-16 22:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-16 23:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(33 comments)

This document is in poor shape overall.
At some point someone merged some of the LBaaSv1 API spec into this in error.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-01-16 23:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-17 17:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-22 10:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(34 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:20:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hello everyone, I submit a new patch[1] to modify it and modify the bug/1719259[2], so I'm sorry I will abandon the patch. 
 
[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536288/
[2]https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1719259"}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa
'}, {'created': '2018-01-05 11:16:43.000000000', 'message': 'Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

The protocol_port of listener and the delay of healthmonitor is an integer.
The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa
'}, {'created': '2018-01-15 03:28:59.000000000', 'message': 'Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa
'}, {'created': '2018-01-15 06:15:55.000000000', 'message': 'Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

There is no definition for "status" and "status_description" params
in the pool.

The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa
'}]
commit_message:
Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

There is no definition for "status" and "status_description" params
in the pool.
The protocol_port of listener and the delay of healthmonitor is an
integer.
The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa

commit_message:
Restore branch conditional on tempest-full

This change partially reverts I5d34e5b983b720dc1913d00ccc1a16d81a040d49.
Since the branch conditional can be more effectively applied on the
job definition located in the tempest repo, there is no need to change
the original override.

Partial-bug: 1739829
Depends-on: I8e0aa11cd2d92d5d6f5e9147a407374948920e7f
Change-Id: Ibfbc925af6eb274ced53312301b1733136ba4455

commit_message:
Collect /var/lib/tripleo-config dir

We're facing an issue in upgrade CI where paunch fails with "sequence
item 33: expected string, list found", it's hard to see what triggered
the issue, being able to look at the step config fed into paunch could
help.

This is how the dir looks on my current deployment:

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# du -h /var/lib/tripleo-config/
176K    /var/lib/tripleo-config/

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# ls -1 /var/lib/tripleo-config/
docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
puppet_step_config.pp

Change-Id: I6dea408e5740176906d7257388062302d31a6369

commit_message:
Add tempest-plugins to projects.txt

All these tempest-plugin repos now use the check-requirements template,
so add them to the list of projects so that they get updated together
with the projects they test.

Note this change also sorts projects.txt alphabetically again.

Change-Id: Ifc631b29cd4d782280b6d38afd90ca6979e424fc
Depends-On: Id616198554f6261f4a3557a7c2d97c24c5be0a58

commit_message:
Fixes 'Not enough available memory' log message

Fixes a bug in log output about where 'Not enough available
memory to schedule instance' printed full memory instead of
available memory

Change-Id: Id65e9f5eec9ba1f39bcba24539b11f2e27226941
Closes-Bug: #1735321

commit_message:
routes-control: add 'local_pref' attribute to BGPVPN resource

This adds the 'local_pref' attribute to the BGPVPN resource,
in the DB model definition and migration script, and also
in the API dicts.

Change-Id: I8a4a2ffa0f9f1d8131d2ced735852ad2310642f3
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I677d4a215000ae662bb981462c7f000653054d9b

commit_message:
Fix the storage group missing for external ceph

Using external Ceph with Kolla means there is no storage node for
kolla, but cinder-volume must be run on nodes(it can be controller
nodes or compute nodes), and the external-ceph-guide miss storage node,
this patch to fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1740028
Change-Id: I6cfb86c5c0d7b30291bd9f263fb030e4703d9602

commit_message:
Deprecates old OpenContrail driver

The first OpenContrail Driver was not developed with production ready in mind,
it was more a proof of concept. We do not recommend to use it in production.
Instead a production ready driver is available in the OpenContrail
monolithic Neutron core plugin tree.
This patch deprecates the driver in the Queens release and we plan to
completly remove it in Rocky release.

Change-Id: I07a7e462e174207499f0641a15467a7122447b7e
Partial-Bug: #1743820

commit_message:
bugs-fixed-since: add argument to list StoryBoard entries

If enabled, this includes StoryBoard stories in the output, with a
"storyboard:" prefix.

Example output:
$ ./bugs-fixed-since.py -sb -r ../octavia --start=1.0.0
storyboard:2001193
storyboard:2001424
1713873
storyboard:2001401
[...]

This is disabled for compatibility with other tools parsing
bugs-fixed-since output

Change-Id: Iddde675254a8622d498cab581d522bffdd7fbaae

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 19:45:57.000000000', 'message': 'db: refresh port association db object after route update

When routes are removed or added to a port association
DB, we need to refresh our DB object or else the dict
produced will be generated from the non-updated set of
routes.

Change-Id: Ib77813247058a4dafed5c36b3dc46717282f200a
Related-Bug: 1743574
'}]
commit_message:
db: refresh port association db object after route update

When routes are removed or added to a port association
DB, we need to refresh our DB object or else the dict
produced will be generated from the non-updated set of
routes.

Change-Id: Ib77813247058a4dafed5c36b3dc46717282f200a
Related-Bug: 1743574

commit_message:
helm-toolkit prometheus service annotation clean up

This adds checks for the fields in the service annotations for
prometheus, similar to the pod annotations. It changes the
setting of annotations by ingesting a prometheus: key under a
top-level monitoring tree to allow for configuration of other
monitoring solutions aside from prometheus

Change-Id: Id05f235ae07407ea4dcd45bce3a26dd92293b116

commit_message:
only make single request for container listings

The proxy was making multiple backend requests for each
container object or shard range listing when handling a
sharded container listing, but only using one response.
Change that to use a single subrequest.

Also re-work _get_sharded in attempt to make flow easier
to follow and get better separation of the sharding state
special cases.

Also add unit tests for sharded container listing handling
in proxy controller.

Change-Id: I1a99d606ef5c6e980879c116d4ad8d3da39fd247

[{'created': '2018-01-12 15:02:38.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings

Ensure that the container-server GET response for shard ranges always
returns a list that covers the entire namespace. This allows
simplification of the proxy-server side GET code.

While in sharding state the container may not yet have an entire
namespace worth of shard ranges so when necessary a filler shard range
is added on the container-server side to cover any as yet uncleaved
namespace.

Change-Id: Ib38d75e04008509f4934bddf885fe030e56dfad0

commit_message:
Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings

Ensure that the container-server GET response for shard ranges always
returns a list that covers the entire namespace. This allows
simplification of the proxy-server side GET code.

While in sharding state the container may not yet have an entire
namespace worth of shard ranges so when necessary a filler shard range
is added on the container-server side to cover any as yet uncleaved
namespace.

Drive-by fix for container listing limit param not being cast to int
before being used in calculations.

Adds new probe test specifically to test listings with params during
sharding.

Change-Id: Ib38d75e04008509f4934bddf885fe030e56dfad0

[{'created': '2017-12-24 22:59:56.000000000', 'message': "[placement] Fix getting placement request ID

In response headers, there is no 'openstack-request-id' header.
So it is not necessary to check the 'openstack-request-id' header.

And 'x-openstack-request-id' is defined in oslo.middleware.
So use the constant value in oslo.middleware.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

Change-Id: Id14fb86ea9786bb22eb6b206cb10f115f9b56ea2
(cherry-picked from commit 560ebe4a56fb45e222d6b008eaabf87b2ccd53e4)
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] Fix getting placement request ID

In response headers, there is no 'openstack-request-id' header.
So it is not necessary to check the 'openstack-request-id' header.

And 'x-openstack-request-id' is defined in oslo.middleware.
So use the constant value in oslo.middleware.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

Change-Id: Id14fb86ea9786bb22eb6b206cb10f115f9b56ea2
(cherry-picked from commit 560ebe4a56fb45e222d6b008eaabf87b2ccd53e4)

[{'created': '2018-01-04 12:26:22.000000000', 'message': 'Undeprecate [scenario]/img_dir

The ``[scenario]/img_dir`` option was prematurely deprecated ahead of
providing a replacement option. Even though the eventual intention is to
be able to remove it in favor of requiring a full path to the image to
upload[1], this has not been fully implemented and the option is still
required if the user wants to use anything but the default. This patch
undeprecates the option so that, while the other work is being
completed, the option can be used without creating a frustrating user
experience. When a replacement option is introduced, this option can be
deprecated again.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1393881
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/scenario/manager.py?h=17.2.0#n389

Change-Id: I320237b84b641749aa0db3967e957c9ae94e5ea2
Closes-bug: #1740258
'}]
commit_message:
Undeprecate [scenario]/img_dir

The ``[scenario]/img_dir`` option was prematurely deprecated ahead of
providing a replacement option. Even though the eventual intention is to
be able to remove it in favor of requiring a full path to the image to
upload[1], this has not been fully implemented and the option is still
required if the user wants to use anything but the default. This patch
undeprecates the option so that, while the other work is being
completed, the option can be used without creating a frustrating user
experience. When a replacement option is introduced, this option can be
deprecated again.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1393881
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/scenario/manager.py?h=17.2.0#n389

Change-Id: I320237b84b641749aa0db3967e957c9ae94e5ea2
Closes-bug: #1740258

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I0a8a5ac589b121e3a3ee98979c53340a1467f45c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 12:27:55.000000000', 'message': "OVSBridge: add --strict to allow priority in delete_flows

n8g-sfc currently has its own variant of OVSBridge to allow the use
of priority in a delete_flows call

This change is meant to make this available outside n8g-sfc and
simplify n8g-sfc code.

This change adds a 'strict' boolean parameter to mod_flow and delete_flows
that results in ovs-ofctl to be run with --strict for del-flows and
mod-flows actions.  When strict is set, the use of priority is allowed
and hence not rejected anymore.

Note that for batched actions in a deffered bridge, we disallow mixing
calls with strict and without strict, which can't be translated in one CLI
call.

Needed-By: I3bf939590dd43bff685f133bff86eb7e9068de91
Change-Id: I289d546780f10dc1002ab6bc2e1b38c9ef2d728f
(cherry picked from commit 5981bf416d39f8ec15c937dabaf16d39a101d6ee)
"}]
commit_message:
OVSBridge: add --strict to allow priority in delete_flows

n8g-sfc currently has its own variant of OVSBridge to allow the use
of priority in a delete_flows call

This change is meant to make this available outside n8g-sfc and
simplify n8g-sfc code.

This change adds a 'strict' boolean parameter to mod_flow and delete_flows
that results in ovs-ofctl to be run with --strict for del-flows and
mod-flows actions.  When strict is set, the use of priority is allowed
and hence not rejected anymore.

Note that for batched actions in a deffered bridge, we disallow mixing
calls with strict and without strict, which can't be translated in one CLI
call.

Needed-By: I3bf939590dd43bff685f133bff86eb7e9068de91
Change-Id: I289d546780f10dc1002ab6bc2e1b38c9ef2d728f
(cherry picked from commit 5981bf416d39f8ec15c937dabaf16d39a101d6ee)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

Hi, I'm not very familiar with this code. However, at least imported Ubuntu cloud images do not require anything special to boot, as the bootloader code is already provisioned on the stock cloud images and should not be overwritten on import.

If this is to do with some other image creation, then it makes sense.

On Ubuntu side we do something similar to:
chroot mountpoint /sbin/zipl -V \
  --image=/boot/vmlinuz \
  --ramdisk=/boot/initrd.img \
  --parameters='root=LABEL=cloudimg-rootfs' \
  --target=/boot/ \
  --targetbase=$loop_device \
  --targettype=SCSI \
  --targetblocksize=512 \
  --targetoffset=2048

Regards,

Dimitri."}, {'account_id': 23745, 'date': '2016-10-13 16:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2016-10-13 16:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add zipl support for s390 architecture with SCSI boot

s390x architecture has zipl as a bootloader. It requires special
treatment in order to make the image bootable.
After mounting the image we install a SCSI-type bootmap on the
volume.

addressed conflict with 287784

Change-Id: I88fb1e4cb8abc28663798e5d22d3a9d209a0e05e
Signed-off-by: Holger Smolinski <smolinski@de.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 09:13:06.000000000', 'message': "WIP: XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will take the responsibility to manage
  OVS located in XenServer dom0; the existing agent server -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will take the responsibilty on other
  OVS functions - e.g. neutron-dhcp-agent, neutron-l3-agent, etc.
  So when virt driver is XenAPI, this new service will be eanbled
  on the hosts which belong to `compute`; the existing service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will be eanbled on the hosts which
  require OVS agent for non-compute purposes.

* Customize relative configure options for XenAPI.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09
blueprint: xenserver-support
"}, {'created': '2017-12-08 09:26:06.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* Customize relative configure options for XenAPI.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09

"}, {'created': '2018-01-08 04:02:22.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieve XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

* Basing on the XenAPI variables, it will customize relative ml2_conf.ini's
  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09

"}, {'created': '2018-01-12 09:44:31.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieves XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

* Basing on the XenAPI variables, it will customize relative ml2_conf.ini's
  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

* At the moment, l2_population doesn't for for XenAPI. So disable it.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09
blueprint: xenserver-support

commit_message:
XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieves XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

* Basing on the XenAPI variables, it will customize relative ml2_conf.ini's
  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

* At the moment, l2_population doesn't for for XenAPI. So disable it.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09
blueprint: xenserver-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 04:02:22.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: Support compute node bootstrap

This is to add a bootstrap task for XenAPI to boostrap the compute
node. One compute node is composed with a XenServer and a DomU VM
running on the XenServer. Before it's ready for deploying OpenStack
sevices on it, we need boostrap it firstly. The package of os-xenapi
has a tool developed to finish all of the needed boostrap tasks
e.g.:
1. configure himn(host internal management network)
2. configure ipatables to allow traffic
3. install xapi plugins to dom0
4. gather XenAPI facts and save them into a file
...

The task added in this commit is to invoke that tool so that the
boostrap tasks can be completed automatically during kolla deployment.

Depends-On: Ie2d7d40f2755580aac4a10f3d302190a8bd4fe6f
Change-Id: I1500535a1c9a085bcbfec5db5fbddcf040e6892d
blueprint: xenserver-support

commit_message:
XenAPI: Support compute node bootstrap

This is to add a bootstrap task for XenAPI to bootstrap the compute
node. One compute node is composed with a XenServer and a DomU VM
running on the XenServer. Before it's ready for deploying OpenStack
sevices on it, we need bootstrap it firstly. The package of
python-os-xenapi contains a tool and some utils which were developed
to finish all of the needed bootstrap tasks
e.g.:
1. configure himn(host internal management network)
2. configure ipatables to allow traffic
3. install xapi plugins to dom0
4. gather XenAPI facts and save them into a file
...

The task added in this commit is to invoke that tool so that the
bootstrap tasks can be completed automatically during kolla deployment.

Depends-On: Ie2d7d40f2755580aac4a10f3d302190a8bd4fe6f
Change-Id: I1500535a1c9a085bcbfec5db5fbddcf040e6892d
blueprint: xenserver-support

commit_message:
Added the limit on selection of delayed calls

It would be good when you have many Mistral-Engine instances.
It distributes selection of delayed calls between all of them.
Also replaced the sleep function by the await function in the tests.

Change-Id: I4f0e0a79ff8169ee4e9b359015db22898f634614
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Use stevedore for binding drivers

In order to avoid direct usage of importutils, this
change brings the usage of stevedore. Import paths
are going to be specified in setup.cfg.

Change-Id: I6628279a8c090ae5827ad6e0257ce7cf9526be0d
Closes-Bug: #1645589

commit_message:
Add 'update' command to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the 'update' command.

The trove command update is now:
    openstack database instance update

Change-Id: I426c892540f82bc19b7b28d7845a2f6699c3f526
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

One comment inline'}, {'account_id': 26589, 'date': '2018-01-22 05:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thanks for that patch. @peiy
 > One comment inline
I don't think so, 
certainly, replace 'if' by 'elif' doesn't make any effective, but it makes more correct in this case. take this as a view: if cond1 return value1 elif cond2 return value2 elif cond3 return value3 else return value4

what 's more, the replacement doesn't change the logical sequence, at least in this case."}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-01-22 06:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

more readable, more effective.

"}]
commit_message:
elif replace if

3 'if' at same levels and each 'if' has 'return',
in this case, elif is better than if.
more readable, more effective.

Change-Id: Ib0528ab69679f320f1580971945ce36eaaedf011
Signed-off-by: peiy <peiy@rc.inesa.com>

commit_message:
Wait for volume creation

If users create a container with new cinder volumes and the volumes
are 'creating'. Zun should wait for the volume creation before
proceeding the container creation process.

Change-Id: I423a69a97271a2acdd73a85cccddb65b052d169e
Closes-Bug: #1740942

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for magnum

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Magnum. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'magnum_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Magnum project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: Id479bf4dc77ee4a2367c9c7d8f0f00de761b8c85
